His work has been exhibited widely and is in the collections of the Museum of Modern Art, the Whitney Museum, and the Metropolitan Museum of Art, among others. He passed away in 1992.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Darrel Ellis were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 2000 by Allen Frame. They include an exhibition program, an artist's book, photographs of artwork, correspondence, exhibition materials, printouts of artwork, a periodical, a catalog of art, publications, interview transcripts, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1990-2023.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Yigal Elyadin was born in 1950 in Tel Aviv, Israel and came to the United States in 1960. He was educated at the Philadelphia College of Art with a degree in Environmental Design. He worked in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania in the design field before devoting himself solely to making art.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Yigal Elyadin first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain a biography, correspondence, ephemera, images lists, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1990-2000.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: John Engstrom was born in 1955 in Boston, Massachusetts. He was educated at Boston University. His photography work has been exhibited in Massachusetts and New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: John Engstrom first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1999. They contain a CV, an artist's biography, correspondence, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1994-2000.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: James K. Fackrell was born in 1962 in San Diego, California. He was educated at Fresno City College and the Student Arts League in New York. His work was exhibited widely in California and New York. His work includes photography, sculpture, and mixed media.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: James K. Fackrell first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2002. They contain an exhibition announcement, correspondence, a CV, artist's statements, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1988-2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Rotimi Fani-Kayode was born in 1955 in Lagos, Nigeria. His family moved to the UK in 1966. He received a BA from Georgetown University and an MFA from Pratt Institute before moving back to the UK where he lived until his death. He worked primarily in photography, including large-scale portraits focusing on the black male body. He passed away in 1989.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Material pertaining to Rotimi Fani-Kayode include exhibition announcements, an exhibition program, and correspondence. These materials are dated 2011-2019.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Robert Farber was born in 1948 in Hartsdale, New York. He received a theater degree from Brandeis University, in Waltham, Massachusetts, and spent a year at the London School of Dramatic Art. He later studied art at the Art Students League. His work is in the permanent collections of the Museum of Modern Art and the Victoria and Albert Museum. He passed away in 1995.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Robert Farber were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998 by John Paradiso. They contain exhibition announcements, correspondence, CVs, photocopies of press clippings, artist's statements, photographs of artwork, periodicals, and exhibition catalogs. These materials are dated 1992-1998.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: David Faulk was born in 1963 in New York. He studied painting at Syracuse University, as well as in Italy. Many of his paintings feature a character named Lulu. His work has been exhibited in California and New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: David Faulk first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2004. They contain exhibition announcements, postcards, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, CVs, artist's statements, photocopies of press clippings, correspondence, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1991-2008.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Tony Feher was born in 1956 in Albuquerque, New Mexico. He received a BA from the University of Texas and then lived in New York City. His practice spanned sculpture, printmaking, and mixed media, often incorporating found materials. His work can be found in the collections of the Guggenheim, the Whitney Museum, the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art, and the Art Institute of Chicago. He passed away in 2016.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Tony Feher donated to the Visual AIDS archive contain memorial materials, correspondence, exhibition announcements, photographs of art, CVs, press releases, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, an artist's statement, press clippings, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1991-2016.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Arnold Fern was born in 1952 in Brooklyn, New York. He studied at the Cornell University College of Art and Architecture. He owned three Manhattan restaurants. He primarily produced large oil paintings and worked as a fabric designer. His work has been exhibited in New York and Washington, DC. He passed away in 1993.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Arnold Fern were donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain photographs of artwork, correspondence, exhibition catalogs, CVs, photocopies of press clipping and obituaries, prints of artwork, and 35mm slide documentation of artwork. These materials are dated 1984-1993.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Orlando Ferrand-Rodriguez was born in 1967 in Cuba. He studied at the Instituto Superior de Arte in Havana, Cuba, as well as Parsons School of Design and Pratt Institute in New York. He is a poet and multi-disciplinary artist. His work has been shown in Cuba, Mexico, Spain, Canada, and the US.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Orlando Ferrand-Rodriguez first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2009. They contain an artist's biography, an artist's statement, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, and a CD with images of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 2004-2008.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Miguel Ferrando was born in 1957 in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic. He moved to New York at the age of five and lived there his whole life. He studied at Cooper Union and the Brooklyn Museum Art School. His paintings often blended art historical motifs with references to the Dominican Republic. His work has been exhibited in New York, Zurich, and Mexico City. He passed away in 1996.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Miguel Ferrando were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998 by Teresa Ferrando Kleint. They contain photographic prints of artwork, correspondence, a CV, artist's biographies, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1975-1996.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Anselmo Figueiredo has an background in architecture which informs his sculptural work. He sculpts primarily with stone, creating abstract and figurative shapes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Anselmo Figueiredo donated to the Visual AIDS archive contain an artist's statement, exhibition programs, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1992-1995.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Enrico Filippi was born in 1953 in New York. He worked in photography and illustration. He passed away in 2002.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Enrico Filippi first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1999. They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, artist's statement, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1998-2001.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Rich Fine was born in 1986 in Alabama. He received formal training in theatrical design in Chicago, fine craft in Portland, Oregon, and classical painting in New York City. He later apprenticed in Paris. He is a painter who employs a biographically expressionistic style.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Rich Fine include Postcards from the Edge submission materials.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Robert Flack was born in 1957 in Ontario, Canada. He studied at Sheridan College in Oakville, Ontario, and York University in Toronto. He worked primarily in photography. His work was exhibited in Canada, the US, France, Germany, Japan, and Australia. He passed away in 1993.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Robert Flack were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998 by John Flack. They contain CVs, correspondence, photocopies of press clippings and obituaries, photographic prints of artwork, a CD with images of art, exhibition catalogs, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1990-2000.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: SJ Fleck was born in 1979 in Detroit, Michigan. He studied at Central Michigan University and Eastern Michigan University, majoring in film with a minor in art photography. He then studied at Oakland University where he learned painting, studio art, and business. His practice spans painting, illustration, screen printing, and photography. He lives and works in Detroit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to SJ Fleck include copies of zines dated 2019.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Luis Frangella was born in 1944 in Buenos Aires. He began to paint in the mid-1970's during a fellowship at MIT's Center for Advanced Visual Studies in Cambridge, Massachusetts. He moved to New York City in 1976, and became part of the burgeoning downtown arts scene. He worked in both painting and sculpture and his work has been exhibited in New York, Buenos Aires, Barcelona, and Madrid. He passed away in 1990.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Luis Frangella were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 2012 by Rosalia Malaccorto Frangella. They contain 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1983-1985.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Benjamin Fredrickson was born in 1980 in Minneapolis, Minnesota. He studied at the Paris College of Art before earning a BFA from the Minneapolis College of Art and Design. His photography centers on portraiture and subcultural taboos. His work has been exhibited in New York and published widely. He lives and works in Brooklyn.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Benjamin Fredrickson include exhibition announcements and a periodical. These materials are dated 2009-2014.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Martin Freeman was born in 1946 in Martinez, California. He studied theatre and floristry in San Francisco. His sculptures and paintings have been exhibited in California, New Mexico, and Washington.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Martin Freeman first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1999. They contain CDs with images of artwork, exhibition announcements, correspondence, art on greeting cards, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, a CV, an artist's statement, calendar submission materials, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1999-2016.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jerry Frost was born in 1950 in Louisville, Kentucky. He received a BA and MA from Chico State University in Chico, California. He works primarily in oil painting. His art has been exhibited in San Francisco and New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Jerry Frost first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2003. They contain CDs with images of art, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, printouts of artwork images, CVs, artist's statements, exhibition announcements, image lists, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 2001-2012.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Louis Fulgoni was born in 1936 in Staten Island, New York. He studied at the School of Visual Art. He was a graphic artist, print-maker, painter, and sculptor. He passed away in 1989.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Louis Fulgoni were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 2013 by Michael McKee. They contain obituaries and an exhibition press release. These materials are dated 1989-2013.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Milton Garcia Jr aka MGNinja was born in 1970 in New York City. He studied at Hostos Community College and the Laboratory Institute of Merchandising. He is an artist, cartoonist, dancer, choreographer, public speaker, and prominent member of New York City's ballroom scene. His work has been exhibited in New York and New Jersey.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Milton Garcia Jr first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain exhibition announcements, CVs, an artist's biography, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, correspondence, photocopies of artwork, periodicals, a CD with images of art, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1996-2007.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Stephen Gemberling was born in 1947 in York, Pennsylvania. He studied sculpture, architecture, and art history at Cooper Union.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Stephen Gemberling first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2010. They contain a CD with images of art with accompanying image list, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, and exhibition announcements. These materials are dated 2004-2017.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Michael Golden was born in 1959 in Fayetteville, North Carolina. He studied at the University of Notre Dame, Washington University, and the University of Texas before completing his MFA in printmaking and drawing at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. His work has been exhibited widely across the United States. His studio is in Houston where he also curates exhibitions in area galleries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Michael Golden first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2004. They contain a CD with images of artwork, ephemera, exhibition announcements, CVs, photocopies of press clippings, correspondence, artist's statements, exhibition catalogs, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1995-2016.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Benjamin Gonzalez (also known as La Buruquena) was born in 1976. He works primarily in photography, sculpture work, painting, and mixed media all with strong religious themes. He lives and works in New York City.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Benjamin Gonzalez include photographs of artwork, an artist's statement and grant application materials.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Carlos Gonzalez was born in 1953 in Puerto Rico. He studied art and design at New York Community College. He works with oils and ceramics, creating landscapes, seascapes, still lifes, and portraits.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Carlos Gonzalez first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2000. They contain an artist's biography, artwork on paper, and 35mm documentation of artwork. These materials are dated 1999-2003.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Rubin Gonzalez was born in 1955 in Brooklyn, New York. He started making art as as child. His art is primarily mixed media and sculpture, using various materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rubin Gonzalez first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain exhibition announcements, photocopies of press clippings, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image lists. These materials are dated 1986-2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Felix Gonzalez-Torres was born in 1957 in Guaimaro, Cuba. He received a BFA in photography from Pratt Institute and an MFA from the International Center of Photography and New York University. He worked as an art instructor at NYU and was involved in social and political causes. As a part of Group Material, a New York-based art collective, he and fellow members worked collaboratively to inititate community education and cultural activism. His work included everyday materials - stacks of paper, puzzles, candy, strings of lights, beads, and more. His work was conceptual in nature, asking viewers to participate in establishing meaning. He passed away in 1996.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Felix Gonzalez-Torres were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998 by Andrea Rosen. They contain correspondence, exhibition announcements, press clippings, artist's biographies, image lists, press releases, artist's statements, exhibition catalogs, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1988-2001.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Ken Goodman was born in 1950. He worked primarily in oil on canvas. He passed away in 1995.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Ken Goodman were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998 by Keith McDermott. They contain correspondence and 35mm slide documentation of artwork. These materials are dated 1982-1986.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Christian Grados was born in 1974 in Lima, Peru. He moved to New York in 1990 and became a US citizen in 2001. He is a digital photographer, editor, and visual art director in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Christian Grados first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2003. They contain a CD with images of art, an artist's biography, an artist's statement, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 2003.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Daniel Gray was born in 1954 in Aurora, Colorado. He received a BA in music education from Colorado University, Boulder. He started painting after his HIV diagnosis. He also works in stained glass and has owned a stained glass studio since 1976.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Daniel Gray first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain calendar submission materials, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, correspondence, a periodical, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1998-2002.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Tim Greathouse was born in 1950 in Ohio. He was a leading figure in the East Village art scene of the 1980s. He showed his photographs for the first time in 1982 and soon afterward published a book of portraits. He had a gallery in the East Village and worked as an art consultant and graphic designer. He passed away in 1998.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Tim Greathouse were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 2005 by Jay L Katz. They contain exhibition announcements, correspondence, photocopies of press clippings, and 35mm slide documentation of artwork with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1976-2020

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Frank Green was born in 1957 in Cleveland, Ohio. He studied filmmaking at Kent State University. His work included performance, film, and mixed media installations. He passed away in 2013.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Frank Green first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2000. They contain an artist's biography, a CV, an artist's statement, an article written by the artist, photocopies of press clippings, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1994-2001.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Max Greenberg was born in 1966 in Israel and raised in the United States. He lived between Brooklyn, Los Angeles, and New Orleans. He was a photographer, poet, and trumpet player. His work was exhibited in New York, Louisiana, and California. He passed away in 2014.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Max Greenberg first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain a CD with images of artwork, exhibition announcements, periodicals, correspondence, calendar submission materials, artist's biographies, artist's statements, a CV, original poetry, copies of digital articles, press clippings, photographic prints of art, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1997-2014.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Alex Greenfield was born in 1957 in New York. He studied first at the School of Visual Arts and later at the San Francisco Art Institute. He taught painting and exhibited his work in San Francisco, also producing commissions for private and corporate clients. He passed away in 2000.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Alex Greenfield first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain exhibition announcements, CVs, an artist's biography, an artist's statement, a letter of intent, press clippings, exhibition press release, correspondence, periodicals, and 35mm slide documentation of artwork. These materials are dated 1992-2000.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Guytrell Griffin was born in 1977 in Portsmouth, Virginia. He is a lifelong artist and has worked with children as an art therapist. His work has been exhibited in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Guytrell Griffin first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1999. His records include an artist's biography. This material is dated 1999.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Edgard Guanipa was born in 1967 in Caracas, Venezuela. He studied at Cristobal Rojas School of Art, Central University of Venezuela, and the Art Student League in New York. He is a painter and costume designer. His work has been exhibited in Venezuela and the United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Edgard Guanipa first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2000. They contain CDs with images of art, exhibition announcements, correspondence, artwork, CVs, calendar submission materials, an artist's statement, press clippings, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1995-2019.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Rebecca Guberman-Bloom was born in 1971 in Los Angeles, California. She studied photography at the Pacific Northwest College of Art in Portland, Oregon. Her photography, film, and painting work has been exhibited widely across the US, primarily in New York and Oregon.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rebecca Guberman-Bloom first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain photographs, correspondence, exhibition announcements, exhibition catalogs, project submission materials, an artist's statement, calendar submission materials, CVs, periodicals, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1997-2004.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Sunil Gupta was born in 1953 in New Delhi, India and moved to Canada at age 15. He studied photography at the New School in New York and the Royal College of Art in London, UK. His photography has been exhibited widely and he has curated over 30 exhibitions as well as conferences, lectures, and presentations internationally. His work is in many public collections in the US, UK, Canada, and Japan.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sunil Gupta first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1999. They contain exhibition announcements, an exhibition catalog, CVs, correspondence, press releases, image lists, press clippings, and 35mm slide documentation of artwork. These materials are dated 1997-2015.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Carlos Gutierrez-Solana was born in 1947 in Havana, Cuba. He received a BFA from Kansas City Art Institute and an MA from University of California, Berkeley. He works with a variety of materials, formats, and genres, including painting, sculpture, and performance. He has also worked as a curator, arts administrator, and museum professional.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Carlos Gutierrez-Solana first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2000. They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, correspondence, CVs, press clippings, an exhibition catalog, periodicals, a CD with images of art, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1994-2021.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Thomas Hageraats is a Dutch artist. He primarily works in photography.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Thomas Hageraats first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2006. They contain a CD with images of art and correspondence. These materials are dated 1994-2006.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Donna Haggerty was born in 1939 in Scranton, Pennsylvania. She took photography classes in San Francisco and has exhibited throughout California.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Donna Haggerty first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1999. They contain photographs of artwork, an artist's statement, a CV, correspondence, and 35mm slide documentation of artwork with accompanying slide list. These materials are dated 1997-2000.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: John Hanning was born in 1961 in Paragould, Arkansas. He studied at Memphis College of Art, the School of Visual Arts, Fashion Institute of Technology, and Parsons School of Design. His painting work includes iconography from his life and childhood. In 1985 he created Cosmo, a stick figure alter ego. His work has been shown internationally and is in the collections of many New York museums. He lives and works in Brooklyn.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: John Hanning first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2012. They contain correspondence, ephemera, an artist's biography, a slide list, and press clippings. These materials are dated 2011-2013.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Russ Hansen was born in 1952 in Vinalhaven, Maine. He studied etching, graphic design, painting, and art history. He worked primarily in paintings. He passed away in 2001.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Russ Hansen first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain an artist's statement, calendar submission materials, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1978-1998.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Michael Harewood was born in 1959 in Brooklyn, New York. He studied textile design and advertising, as well as working as a sign painter in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Michael Harewood first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2005. They contain correspondence, a CV, and photographs of art. These materials are dated 2005.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Keith Haring was born in 1958 in Reading, Pennsylvania. He developed a love for drawing at an early age and studied at the School of Visual Arts, where he found a thriving alternative art community in downtown Manhattan. At school he experimented with performance video, installation and collage. He started using blank advertising panels in the subway to draw. Gaining international recognition in the 1980s, his work was exhibited widely in galleries in addition to his public works. He passed away in 1990.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Keith Haring include exhibition announcements, exhibition posters, correspondence, exhibition materials, press releases, press clippings, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1980-2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Imani "Iye" Harrington was born in 1958 in Berkeley, California. Her work spans various media including photography, painting, sculpture, performance, writing, and digital art. She has received many awards for her writing and activism.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Imani "Iye" Harrington first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2011. They contain correspondence, ephemera, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, artist's statements, image lists, grant materials, and a headshot. These materials are dated 2011-2013.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Michael Harwood was born in 1946 in New York City. He received a BA from Columbia College. He has been exhibiting photography since the 1970s. His work is in the collections of the Leslie-Lohman Museum of Gay and Lesbian Art, Cornell University, and Tim of Finland Foundation as well as private collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Michael Harwood first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain exhibition announcements, a CD with images of art, correspondence, CVs, artist's statements, press releases, photocopies of artwork, press clippings, a gallery image list, periodicals, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image lists. These materials are dated 1984-2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Garry Hayes was born in 1961 in Indiana. He studied at the American Academy of Art, Chicago and the Minneapolis College of Art and Design, after which he moved to New York City. He started as a painter before switching to sculpture and collage, often using art books as material. He passed away in 2010.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Garry Hayes first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2010. His material includes a CD with images of artwork. These materials are dated 2010.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Christopher Helouin was born in 1960. His work includes photography, sculpture, and pottery.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Christopher Helouin include photographs.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: David Lester Herbert was born in 1961 in Charlestown, West Virginia. He studied at the Jefferson School of Arts and his work was exhibited in Baltimore, Maryland. He works primarily in poetry, letters, plays, paintings, and ink drawings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: David Lester Herbert first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain correspondence, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, writings by artist, photocopies of artwork, and original drawings. These materials are dated 1997-1998.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Bryan Hoffman was born in 1960 in Michigan. He studied at Wayne State University in Detroit, Michigan. His paintings have been exhibited in various shows in New York and Boston. He also worked in fashion as the director of advertising for Bill Blass.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bryan Hoffman first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain exhibition announcements, correspondence, photographs of art, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1995-1999.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Richard Hofmann was born in 1954 in Newark, New Jersey. He earned a BFA from Pratt Institute. He lived in the East Village during the 1980s where he decorated clubs with his murals. His work was primarily in large-scale figurative oil painting but also includes watercolors, photo lithographs, etchings, mixed media collage, and artist books. His work has been exhibited in New York and Chicago. He passed away in 1994.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Richard Francis Hofmann include estate contact information. This material is undated.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Chet Holcomb was born in 1966 in Johnson City, New York. His work includes painting and sculpture, often with unusual materials. His work has been exhibited in New York and Washington, DC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Chet Holcomb first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain exhibition announcements, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, artist's statements, correspondence, and 35mm slide documentation with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1993-2007.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Frank Holliday was born in 1957 in North Carolina. He studied at the San Francisco Art Institute, New York Studio School, and School of Visual Arts. He is associated with the East Village scene in the 1970s and 80s and is a prolific painter. His work has been exhibited widely in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Frank Holliday first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain exhibition announcements, exhibition catalogs, CVs, an artist's biography, calendar submission materials, press clippings, an image list, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1996-2001.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: horea was born in 1957 in Tirgu-Mores, Romania and immigrated to the US in 1986. He received an MS in Civil Engineering from The Polytechnic Institute in Cluj-Napoca, Transylvania and an MFA from Arizona State University. His work has been exhibited across the United States and is often comprised of various media.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: horea first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2004. They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, exhibition announcements, CDs with images of art, exhibition programs, CVs, press releases, artist's statements, press clippings, copies of artwork, correspondence, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image lists. These materials are dated 1994-2017.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Joel Hoyer was born in 1945. He studied in Italy, England, New York, San Francisco, and Portland. His work includes paintings and sculpture and has been exhibited across the country.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Joel Hoyer first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2001. They contain CDs with images of art, an exhibition catalog, ephemera, CVs, artist's statements, digital image lists, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1995-2006.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Tim Hughes was born in 1970 in South Carolina and moved around frequently in childhood. He works primarily in painting. They have been exhibited in and around Atlanta.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tim Hughes first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2006. They contain exhibition announcements, an artist's biography, correspondence, and images of art. These materials are dated 2006.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Peter Hujar was born in 1934 in Trenton, New Jersey. He received his first camera in 1947 and in 1953 entered the School of Industrial Art, developing his photographic knowledge by working in commercial photo studios. He was a leading figure in the downtown scene in New York in the 1970s and 80s and acted as a mentor to David Wojnarowicz. His work was primarily in black and white portraiture. His work has been exhibited widely in New York and internationally. He passed away in 1987.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Peter Hujar include exhibition catalogs. These materials are dated 1999-2016.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Scott Hunt was born in 1958 in Tarrytown, New York. He received a BFA in illustration from Parsons School of Design. His work incorporates found photographs with charcoal illustration, and has been exhibited in Germany and New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Scott Hunt first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2009. They contain a CD with images of art, an artist's statement, ephemera, a CV, a curator's statement, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 2006-2009.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: River Huston was born in 1960 in Levittown, Pennsylvania. She received a BA in Music and Physical Education from Hunter College and an honorary doctorate from Albright College. Her work has been widely published and exhibited, and she has spoken at numerous colleges and universities throughout her career. She currently lives and work in Santa Monica, California.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: River Huston first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2009. They contain a CD with images of art, CVs, correspondence, image lists, and press clippings. These materials are dated 1995-2000.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: W. Benjamin Incerti was born in 1951. He was a photographer and AIDS activist who worked with various organizations in Boston. His work has been exhibited in Boston. He passed away in 1993.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to W. Benjamin Incerti were donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998 by Robert Sessions. They contain artist's biographies and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1990-2000.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Kenny Lee (Inkedkenny) was born in 1967. His photography primarily centers gay culture and has appeared in various publications and has been exhibited in Canada.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Kenny Lee (Inkedkenny) first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2009. They include a CD with images of art, a digital image list, and a periodical. These materials are dated 2009-2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: JD Isaacs was born in 1953 in Dayton, Ohio. He received a BA in Communications from the University of Central Florida. His work includes sculpture and paintings, which have been exhibited in Georgia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: JD Isaacs first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2010. They contain correspondence and a CD with images of art and accompanying image list. These materials are dated 2009-2010.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Affrekka Jefferson was born in 1950 in Brooklyn, New York. She received a BFA from the School of Visual Arts in New York. She worked primarily in printmaking, as well as oil painting. She was a lifetime member of the Art Students' League and her art is on permanent display at the Bedford-Stuyvesant Restoration in Brooklyn. She passed away in 2004.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Affrekka Jefferson first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain an artist's statement, calendar submission materials, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, scans of artwork, periodicals, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1980-2002.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jerry the Marble Faun was born in 1955 in Brooklyn, New York. He is a Queens-based artist working primarily in stone and earthenware sculpture. He is known from his appearance in the 1975 documentary Grey Gardens, where he received his nickname. His work has been exhibited widely in New York and has been written about in numerous publications. In addition to sculpting, he has worked as a taxi driver, a performer, and a gardener.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Jerry the Marble Faun include a publication dated 2015.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: David Jester was born in 1960 and started drawing and painting at a young age. He received a BFA from Virginia Commonwealth University and an MFA from Rutgers University. He works in painting, primarily oil on wood.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to David Jester donated to the Visual AIDS archive contain grant application materials and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1995-1996.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Joe Jimenez was born in 1976 in Arkansas Pass, Texas. He received a BA in English from Pomona College in California. He is a writer, photographer, editor, and altar artist. He is also a nationally recognized community organizer. His work has been published and exhibited widely.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Joe Jimenez first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2002. They contain an artist's biography, an artist's statement, and CVs. These materials are dated 2002.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Tim Jocelyn was born in 1952 in Ottawa, Canada. He graduated from Central Technical School in Toronto and became a central figure of the art scene there in the early 1980s. He first emerged as a clothing and accessory designer. His work has been exhibited widely in New York as well as across Canada. He passed away in 1986.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Tim Jocelyn were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998 by Sybil Goldstein. They contain exhibition announcements, an exhibition catalog, a CV, press releases, photocopies of press clippings, correspondence, and 35mm slide documentation with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1980-2002.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Shamar Johnson is a Brooklyn-based artist. His work includes illustration and plaster carving work.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Shamar Johnson include Postcards from the Edge submission materials.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Michael Johnstone was born in 1955 in Edinburgh, Scotland. His artwork contains several mediums. He is primarily a photographer and also collaborates with his partner, David Faulk, to create art from recycled items and participate in colorful street spectacles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Michael Johnstone include postcards with images of artwork.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Constantine Jones was born in 1992 in Tennessee. They received an MFA from City College of New York where they teach creative writing. They are a poet and their work has been published in various outlets and has been performed and exhibited across New York City. They have published a novel and a collaborative chapbook.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Constantine Jones first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2019. They contain correspondence and an event program. These materials are dated 2019.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Darrell G. Jones was born in 1953 in Baltimore, Maryland. After a stint in the US Army, Jones moved to San Francisco and then New York. He studied at Pratt Institute, Fashion Institute of Technology, and the Art Students League. He works primarily in dawing and watercolor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Darrell G Jones first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2001. They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, exhibition announcements, ephemera, an artist's biography, an artist's statement, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1996-2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Frank Jump was born in 1960 in Queens, New York. He received a BA in Music, Theatre and Film from Empire State College and an MS in education from Brooklyn College. He is a founding member of ACT UP and the author of the book Fading Ads of New York City, which documents vintage ads on buildings in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Frank Jump first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain postcards of art, exhibition announcements, artist's biographies, press clippings, exhibition materials, calendar submission materials, artist's statements, photographic prints, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, ephemera, correspondence, periodicals, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1997-2012.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Leslie Kaliades was born in 1961 in New York and educated at Rutgers University and the International Center for Photography in New York. Her photography was exhibited widely across the country and appeared on the cover of Body Positive. She passed away in 1999.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Leslie Kaliades were first donated with the Visual AIDS archive in 1998 by Dorothy Kaliades. They contain CVs, exhibition materials, calendar submission materials, correspondence, exhibition catalogs, ephemera, periodicals, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1989-2003.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Alexander Kargaltsev was born in 1985 and immigrated to the United States in 2010. He is very outspoken politically and his art is a reflection of that. His work is primarily in photography.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Alexander Kargaltsev donated to the Visual AIDS archive contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials and a photograph. These materials are dated 2022-2023.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: John Carlos Keasler was born in 1949 in Texas and moved to California where he pursued painting and woodworking. He studied photography at San Diego City College as well as receiving a BA from North Texas State University. He served as the exhibition coordinator for San Diego non-profit organization AIDS Art Alive and has curated various other exhibitions as well as facilitating art therapy sessions. He lives in California.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: John Carlos Keasler first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2011. They contain a CD with images of art, a pamphlet of information about the artist, and a periodical. These materials are dated 2004-2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Adrian Kellard was born in 1959 in New Rochelle, New York. He studied at SUNY Purchase. His earliest works were woodcut prints which lead to his work with carved and painted wood blocks, often with religious themes. His work has been exhibited in New York as well as in a traveling museum exhibition. He passed away in 1991.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Adrian Kellard donated to the Visual AIDS archive contain exhibition announcements, correspondence, and an excerpt from a press release. These materials are dated 1987-1990.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Sebron Kendrick was born in 1956 in East Chicago, Indiana. He studied at Illinois State University and excelled in both painting and printmaking, while also teaching classes. He received a Masters of Science with a concentration in fine arts also from ISU. He currently lives in Omaha, Nebraska.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sebron Kendrick first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2001. They contain CDs with images of artwork, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, an artist's biography, an artist's statement, CVs, correspondence, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1980-2003.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: David King was born in 1962 in Maine. He studied photography at Boston College and Boston Museum of Fine Arts School, and later received an MA in Anthropology from the California Institute of Integral Studies. His collages have been shown across Europe and the US. He lives in California with his husband.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: David King first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2003. They contain CDs with images of artwork, exhibition announcements, ephemera, catalogs of artwork, CVs, artist's statements, correspondence, grant materials, periodicals, and 35mm slide documentation of artwork. These materials are dated 1992-2010.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jochen Klein was born in 1967. He trained as a painter and studied classical painting at the Academy of Fine Arts in Munich. He turned away from classical painting and worked in conceptual art, joining the New York art collective Group Material. He moved to London in 1995 and continued painting, becoming known for his idyllic landscape scenes. He was also very actively socially and politically. He passed away in 1997.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Jochen Klein donated to the Visual AIDS archive contain a press release and a gallery image list. These materials are dated 2017.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: David Knudsvig was born in Stoughton, Wisconsin in 1947. He studied at St. Olaf's College, Los Angeles City College, and the University of Minnesota. His work used dense geometric patterning centered around the cteno, the Greek prefix for a five-pronged, comb-like for typically associated with zoological and aquatic creatures (for example, the comb jelly Ctenophora). Knudsvig's systems, ultimately, find the esoteric in the human; "five fingers," as the artist wrote in a diary entry, is "the pre- cursor to all ctenos." These figures have associations with counting, time, DNA and ancient text. His work was exhibited in New York. He passed away in 1993.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to David Knudsvig were donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain correspondence, a CD, a press release, a CV, an artist's statement, ephemera, an inventory list, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1988-1997.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Ken Kostovny was born in 1965 in Los Angeles, California. Though he never had formal art training, he created many paintings and collages that were exhibited in San Francisco. He passed away in Colorado in 1996.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Ken Kostovny were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997 by James Kovotny. They contain an artist's biography, ephemera, correspondence, copies of collage artwork, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1985-1997.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Andre Brown Krauss was born in 1960 in Albany, New York. He received a BA from Mohawk Valley College. His work is primarily painting, photography, and sculpture. It has been exhibited in New York and Florida.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Andre Krauss first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2003. They contain CDs with images of art, correspondence, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1982-1992.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Tseng Kwong Chi was born in 1950 in Hong Kong. He developed an artistic persona in the late 1970s as an "Ambiguous Ambassador" and traveled the world taking photos of himself at stereotypical tourist destinations. He settled in New York in 1979 and became best friend and official photographer to Keith Haring. His work has been exhibited internationally and is held in permanent collections, including the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art, New York's Guggenheim Museum, New York Public Library, New School in New York, Walker Art Center, and Los Angeles County Art Museum, among others. He passed away in 1990.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Tseng Kwong Chi were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998 by Muna Tseng. They contain photographic prints, exhibition announcements, exhibition programs, exhibition catalog, materials pertaining to art usage, an artist's biography, articles, correspondence, periodicals, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1979-2008.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Edwin Lacend was born in 1960 in Puerto Rico and lived and worked in East Harlem. He studied at Parsons School of Design and worked with costume design as well as painting and multi-media art. His work was exhibited throughout New York. He passed away in 2013.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Edwin Lacend first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain CDs with images of artwork, photographs of art, exhibition announcements, ephemera, CVs, correspondence, press clippings, artist's statements, calendar submission materials, grant submission materials, exhibition materials, periodicals, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1996-2006.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jeremy Landau was born in 1949 in New Jersey. He received a BA and MA and was a health promotions professional for over twenty years, serving on President Clinton's Advisory Council. He was also a prolific fine arts and landscape photographer. His work has been exhibited across the US. He lives between New York and New Mexico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Jeremy Landau first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1999. They contain a CD with images of art, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, CVs, correspondence, grant submission materials, artist's statements, and 35mm slide documentation of artwork. These materials are dated 1994-2001.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Morris Lane was born in 1954 in Miami, Florida. He graduated from the Art Institute of New York with a degree in film. He has been a professional photographer for over 40 years, living and working in New York. He has also studied in Europe and photographed various celebrities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Morris Lane first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2011. They contain a CV, an artist's statement, images of the artist, and image lists. These materials are dated 1982-2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: John Larabee was born in 1954 in Topeka, Kansas. He studied painting at the Massachusetts College of Art and the Boston Museum School. His work was exhibited in Provincetown, Boston, and Washington DC during his lifetime. He passed away in 1989 in Boston, Massachusetts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to John Larabee were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998 by Alan Dinsfriend. They contain a CV, an artist's statement, an artist's biography, correspondence, an exhibition catalog, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1987-2003.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: John Lathram was born in 1962 in Lexington, Kentucky. He received both a BFA and an MFA in Art and Technology from Ohio State University. He is a mixed media artist whose work incorporates digital photography, video, robotics, and computer software. His work has been exhibited in New York and Ohio.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: John Lathram first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1999. They contain a CD with images of art, CVs, biographies, press clippings, correspondence, grant submission materials, photographs of artwork, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1995-2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: John Laub was born in 1947 in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. He studied art in Ohio before returning to Philadelphia to pursue graphic design. He switched to painting and immersed himself in the Philadelphia art community. He also did community work with GMHC in New York and spent time in the Fire Island Pines. He exhibited work Philadelphia, DC, San Francisco, and New York. He passed away in 2005.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to John Laub donated to the Visual AIDS archive include artwork on postcards, correspondence, exhibition announcements, exhibition catalogs, photographic documentation of art, a photographic print, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1991-2012.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: David Lee is a New York-based artist. His work is primarily in pastel and acrylic on canvas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: David Lee first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain photographs of the artist, an image list, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1990-1998.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Michael Lee was born in 1956 in Norwich, Connecticut. After high school he moved to New York City and then Paris before returning to New York. There he worked at Bloomingdale's Visual Design Studio. His artwork has been featured in various magazines, and exhibitions in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Michael Lee first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain an exhibition announcement, an artist's biography, correspondence, an artist's statement, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1991-2001.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jonathan Leiter was born in 1959 in Uniontown, Pennsylvania. He grew up in the New York area and received a BA in theater design from Rutgers University where he also studied painting and performance art. He has performed under the name Reuben Sandwich since 1980 in many performance spaces around New York. His visual artwork includes painting, sculpture, collage, and mixed media.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Jonathan Leiter first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain exhibition announcements, images of artwork, CVs, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, a periodical, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1993-2013.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Nancer Lemoins was born in 1956 in St Louis, Missouri. She studied painting and printmaking at Evergreen State College in Olympia, Washington and New College of San Francisco. She lived and worked in San Francisco and has exhibited her art widely in California.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Nancer Lemoins first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2000. They contain photographs of artwork, stickers of artwork, exhibition announcements, ephemera, CDs with images of artwork, CVs, an artist's statement, calendar submission materials, press clippings, correspondence, periodicals, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image lists. These materials are dated 1999-2014.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jose Leonilson Bezerra Dias was born in 1957 in Brazil. He studied at the Escola Pan-Americana de Arte and the Fundação Armando Alvares Penteado (FAAP) in São Paulo. He emerged as a seminal figure of the Brazilian contemporary art world during the 1980s. He traveled extensively and had paintings, drawings, and installations exhibited in France, Germany, Italy, and Spain. After his HIV diagnosis he began to work on intimate embroideries. His art remains in public and private collections internationally. He passed away in 1993.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Jose Leonilson donated to the Visual AIDS archive contain an exhibition announcement. This materials is dated 2018.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Eric Lerner was born in 1961 in Patterson, New Jersey. He received a BA in english from the University of Maryland. He is self-taught in art and his work consists of mixed media, acrylic, and digital manipulation. His work has been exhibited in New York and Maryland. He passed away in 2021.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Eric Lerner first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2007. They contain CDs with images of art, an artist's statement, a CV, an interview, correspondence, calendars, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image lists. These materials are dated 2003-2008.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: John Lesnick was born in 1953. He studied art education and printmaking at SUNY Oneonta, SUNY Buffalo, and Indiana University. He worked primarily in photography, photo screen prints, and photo imagery on ceramic tiles and was widely exhibited. His work is in the collections of the Museum of Modern Aart and the Brooklyn Museum, among others. He passed away in 2003.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: John Lesnick first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain prints of artwork, exhibition announcements, exhibition catalogs, an artist's biography, CVs, press clippings, correspondence, calendar submission materials, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, periodicals, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image lists. These materials are dated 1980-2003.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Fran Lewis was born in 1953 in LeFlore County, Oklahoma and grew up in Santa Barbara, California. She lived and worked in the Bay Area for over 25 years, working in a wide variety of mediums, including acrylic, watercolors, pastels and silk, as well as photography, mixed media sculpture and historical reproduction. She passed away in 2006.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fran Lewis first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain an exhibition announcement, CVs, calendar submission materials, press clippings, an artist's statement, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1996-2005.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Samuel Fleming Lewis was born in 1953 in Los Angeles, CA. He studied figure drawing, fine arts, interior design, and environmental design at Otis Art Institute, Los Angeles City College, and the University of California Extension. He has worked in architecture and interior design while making his mixed media collage works and drawings. His work has been exhibited in California.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Samuel Lewis first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain CVs, artist's statements, correspondence, a photograph of artist, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1995-1997.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Marc Lida was born in 1957 in New York City. He was educated at the Brooklyn Museum Art School, SUNY Purchase, and Parsons School of Design. His work was exhibited in New York, New Jersey, and Connecticut. He passed away in 1992.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Marc Lida were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997 by David Lida. They contain exhibition announcements, correspondence, a scan of artwork, photographic prints of artwork, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1982-1999.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Edward Lightner was born in 1960 in Bakersfield, California. He studied at California State University and University of South Florida. His work has been exhibited in California, Florida, and New York. His work is an ongoing contemplation of his views on life and death. He lives in California.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Edward Lightner first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain exhibition announcements, correspondence, exhibition catalogs, CVs, artist's statements, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, calendar submission materials, press clippings, CD with images of art, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image lists. These materials are dated 1998-2013.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Elliott Linwood was born in 1956 in Massachusetts. He was educated at NYU, University of Chicago, San Francisco State University and the New College of California School of Law, receiving degrees in various fields, as well as teaching at San Francisco State University. His work has been exhibited and won awards throughout the US.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Elliott Linwood first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain exhibition announcements, CDs with images of art, correspondence, CVs, an artist's biography, an artist's statement, press clippings, photographic prints of art, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image lists. These materials are dated 1991-2004

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Kairon Liu was born in 1992 in Taipei, Taiwan. He graduated from the Department of Graphic Communication at Shih Hsin University. He is an artist, curator, and photographer. His work has won many awards and been exhibited internationally. He has also curated several exhibitions in Taipei.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Kairon Liu include exhibition announcements. This material is dated 2018-2023.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Eduardo Lluria-Miralles was born in 1955 in Havana, Cuba. He received a BA in biology from Holy Cross College and an MBA in finance from New York University. After a long career on Wall Street he began to focus on his creative work. He works primarily in oil paintings and his work has been exhibited in Florida.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Eduardo Lluria-Miralles first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain correspondence, an artist's biography, an artist's statement, a CV, press clippings, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1998-2001.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Ronald Lockett was born in 1965 in Bessemer, Alabama. He began making art full time in his early twenties. He was mentored by his older cousin, the artist Thornton Dial. By the time of his death, he had produced over 350 works, primarily mixed media sculptures and paintings. He passed away in 1998.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Ronald Lockett include an exhibition program and an exhibition checklist. These materials are dated 2016.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Charles Ryan Long was born in 1979 in Chicago. His work includes painting, sculpture, installation, and mixed media art.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Charles Long first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2012. They contain exhibition announcements and copies of original artwork. These materials are dated 2012-2016.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Antonio Lopez was born in 1943 in Utuado, Puerto Rico. His family moved to New York City when he was seven. He helped his parents, who worked as a seamstress and a mannequin maker, inspiring a lifelong love of fashion. He went to Traphagen School of Fashion on the weekends as a teenager and later to the Fashion Institute of Technology, going on to illustrate fashions for major publications. He made great strides in exploring and representing the racialized body in the world of high fashion. His imagery helped to develop and underscore a new canon of beauty in the 1970s and 80s. He passed away in 1987.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Antonio Lopez inlude an article and book publication materials. These materials are dated 2004-2016.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Dean Loren was born in 1958 in Washington, DC. He received a BS in Chemistry from the University of Maryland and a JD from Fordham University. His work has been exhibited in New York and represents a variety of mediums, including video, painting, illustration, and sculpture.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dean Loren first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2016. They contain correspondence, a CV, and a list of images as part of grant materials. These materials are dated 2016.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Gin Louie was born in 1953 in Troy, New York. He was raised by a Chinese American family in Chinatown. He taught at the Lower East Side Printshop and produced several public art projects. His artwork was informed by his study in printmaking techniques. He passed away in 1994.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Gin Louie were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 2001 by John Lesnick. They contain exhibition announcements, a CV, correspondence, an artist's biography, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1993-2004.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Michael Lownie was born in 1952 in Buffalo, New York. He received a BFA in painting from Daeman College n Amherst, New York, and later moved to and studied in San Francisco. His work has been exhibited widely in the US, primarily in California and New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Michael Lownie first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2004. They contain CDs with images of art, exhibition announcements, CVs, artist's statements, image lists, correspondence, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image lists. These materials are dated 2004-2009

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Charles Lum was born in 1958 in Rockville Centre, New York. He received a BA in Film Studies from Carleton College in Northfield, Minnesota, and an MFA in Photography from the Art Institute of Chicago. His practice includes documentary and narrative filmmaking, often with sexually explicit content, as well as photography and performance. His work has been exhibited internationally. He passed away in 2021.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Charles Lum first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2006. They contain CDs with images of art, ephemera, exhibition announcements, correspondence, a CV, periodicals, a publication, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 2004-2022.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Peter Madero III was born in 1954 in New York City. He studied at Rutgers University. He worked as a commercial photographer for many years in addition to his artistic practice. He also owned a gallery in Midtown with a specialization in Puerto Rican art.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Peter Madero III first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain correspondence, exhibition announcements, a CV, calendar submission materials, CDs with images of art, calendars of photography, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1998-2007.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Joseph Magliaro was born in 1954 in Newark, New Jersey. He was educated at the Art Students League in New York and worked with various teachers on various scholarships. He works primarily in painting, both realistic and abstract.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Joseph Magliaro first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain a photographic print of artwork, calendar submission materials, an artist's biography, an artist's statement, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1998-2001.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Cornelius Manunure was born in 1963. He studied art, community development, and business studies. He is a sculptor and works primarily in Zimbabwe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cornelius Manunure first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2000. This collection includes a CV. This material is dated 2000-2001.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Hamlet Manzueta was born in 1964 in the Dominican Republic. He studied graphic design and fashion industry at the Fashion Insitute of Technology in New York. His painting, photography, and illustration work has been exhibited in New York and the Dominican Republic. He passed away in 2019.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Hamlet Manzueta first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2002. They contain correspondence, photographic prints of artwork, and 35mm slide documentation with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 2001-2002.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Robert Mapplethorpe was born in 1946 in New York. He received a BFA from Pratt Institute where he produced artwork of various media, mainly collage. His shift to photography happened in the mid-1970s. He took his first photographs of Patti Smith with a polaroid camera and later became known for his portraits of an array of unique people, including many celebrities. His work has been exhibited internationally both during his life and posthumously. He is considered to be among the most important American photographers of the latter half of the 20th century. He passed away in 1989.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Robert Mapplethorpe include promotional materials, correspondence, and press clippings. These materials are dated 1998-2000.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Thom Markee was born in 1974 in Maine. He attended the Art Institute of Boston and studied art, including figure drawing and sculpture. He continued to draw and paint, creating most of his work from 1999-2002. His work has been exhibited in New York and Massachusetts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Thom Markee first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2003. They contain exhibition announcements, photographic prints, CVs, artist's statements, an artist's biography, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, periodicals, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 2002-2013.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: William Neil Marshall was born in 1950 in Ontario, Canada. He was educated at the University of Toronto in art history, philosophy, and renaissance studies. His work has been exhibited widely in the US and Canada.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: William Neil Marshall first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2002. They contain exhibition announcements, exhibition catalogs, correspondence, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying slide list. These materials are dated 1977-2006.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Dani Marti was born in 1963 in Barcelona, Spain. He was educated in Barcelona, Sydney, New York, and Glasgow. His work has been exhibited widely internationally.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dani Marti first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2012. They contain a DVD of work, a CV, and an artist's biography. These materials are dated 2010-2012.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Greg Maskwa was born in 1953 in Canada. He studied painting and textile design at Cambrian College of Applied Art. He then moved to San Francisco in 1972 where he began exhibiting art. He moved to New York in 1979 and worked as a freelance illustrator and writer. His work was been published and exhibited widely and internationally. He passed away in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Greg Maskwa first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2001. They contain a CD with images of art, photographic prints, ephemera, exhibition materials, an artist's biography, artist's statements, press clippings, calendar submission materials, correspondence, memorial materials, periodicals, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1979-2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Quenttel Mathis was born in 1960 in Illinois. He was educated at the New School and Alliance Francaise. He has worked as a photostylist and window display fabricator in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Quenttel Mathis first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2010. This collection contains a CV. These materials are dated 2010.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Frank Maya was born in 1950 in Queens, New York and grew up in Babylon, Long Island. He studied at Hofstra University and after graduating, began a career as a singer, songwriter, and poet, appearing extensively in Manhattan. In the 1980s he redefined himself as a performance artist and later a stand-up comedian. He starred in his own half-hour special on Comedy Central. As a visual artist, he worked primarily in illustration. He passed away in 1995.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Frank Maya include performance announcements and obituaries. These materials are dated 1987-1995.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
