bioghist.p: Amber McCarthy was born in 1968 in Galesburg, Illinois. Her artwork is primarily pencil drawings and acrylic paintings. Her work has been exhibited in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Amber McCarthy first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain grant application materials, photocopies of illustrations, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, correspondence, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1998-2003.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: James Ray McCleskey VI was born in 1938 in Colon, Panama to American parents. He attended the Suwanee Military Academy and was self-taught in photography. He passed away in 1996.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials related to James Ray McCleskey VI were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 2000 by Margaret McCleskey. They contain correspondence. These materials are dated 2000.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Leon McCutcheon was born in 1959. He works primarily in watercolor paintings. He lives and works in New York City.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Leon McCutcheon include a photographic print of artwork.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Joyce McDonald was born in 1951 in Brooklyn, New York. She is a multidisciplinary artist best know for her figurative sculptures. She is a speaker for her church's AIDS ministry and works closely with her community. Her work has been exhibited in New York and London, and is in the collection of the Brooklyn Museum and the Hammer Museum, among others. In 2021, she was the first artist to join West Elm's ceramic residency in Brooklyn.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Joyce McDonald first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain exhibition announcements, correspondence, photographic prints of artwork, ephemera, CVs, artist's biographies, calendar submission materials, artist's statements, image lists. Postcards from the Edge submission materials, press releases, press clippings, event programs, testimonials, newsletters, periodicals, CDs with work, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image lists. These materials are dated 1998-2020.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Preston McGovern was born in 1951 in Wilmington, Delaware. He received a BA from Tusculum College in Tusculum, Tennessee. His work is in mixed media, collage, and sculpture, and has been exhibited in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Preston McGovern first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1999. They contain exhibition announcements, correspondence, image lists, calendar submission materials, press clippings, periodicals, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1982-2000.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Kathryn McGuinness was born in 1958 in New York City. A self-taught artist, Kathryn's work on paper and canvas was a source of joy for her and those around her. She passed away in 2015.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Kathryn McGuiness first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2013. They contain correspondence and grant application materials. These materials are dated 2013-2015.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Andrew McPhail was born in 1961 in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. He received both a BFA and MFA from York University in Toronto. Beginning with illustration on mylar, his art evolved to three dimensional work, performance, and painting. His work has been exhibited internationally.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Andrew McPhail first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2008. They contain a CD with images of art, exhibition announcements, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, CVs, an artist's statement, and press releases. These materials are dated 2006-2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Steven Mendelson was born in 1958 in Highland Park, Illinois. A lifelong artist, he studied at Rhode Island School of Design. He worked as an illustrator for the Washington Post and his work appeared in Europe, India, Latin America, and Japan. He illustrated four books for humor columnist Art Buchwald, and wrote and illustrated children's books. He passed away in 1995.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Steven Mendelson were donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 2000 by Carol Mendelson. They contain a CV, correspondence, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1988-2001.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Lucas Michael was born in 1965 in Buenos Aires, Argentina. He was educated at the Rhode Island School of Design. His work in photography, sculpture, installation, video, and other various media has been shown internationally and featured in multiple publications. He lives and works in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lucas Michael first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2012 and again in 2021. They contain correspondence, a CD with images of art, a CV, an artist's biography, ephemera, exhibition announcements, exhibition catalogs, and artist's statements. These materials are dated 2003-2021.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Karl Michalak was born in 1958 in Binghamton, New York. He received an MFA from Columbia University. He was an artist, cartoonist, art therapist, writer, film critic, performer, and political activist. He passed away in 1997.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Karl Michalak were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998 by Michael Sturza. They contain ephemera, an artist's biography, an artist's statement, correspondence, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image lists. These materials are dated 1989-1998.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Tiger Milner was born in 1960. He is a fine artist, performance artist, graphic designer, display designer, and writer. He has a BA in painting from Florida Gulf Coast University and an MFA in Media Design from Full Sail University. His work includes painting, mixed media, collage, and print making.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tiger Milner first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2013. This collection includes a CD with images of art. This material is dated 2013-2014.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Greg Mitchell was born in 1957 in Wichita, Kansas. He received a BA from Oklahoma City University and a JD from the University of Pittsburgh. He began his photograhic practice with a webcam and later moved on to a point-and-shoot camera. His photography has been exhibited in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Greg Mitchell first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2008. They contain CDs with images of art, ephemera, correspondence, exhibition announcements, CVs, Postcards from the Edges submission materials, press clippings, photocopies of art, photographic prints, and periodicals. These materials are dated 2006-2010.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Kenneth Mitchell was born in 1949 in Brooklyn, New York. He was educated at the School of Visual Arts. He worked as a textile designer and was a celebrated painter. He passed away in 2008.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Kenneth Mitchell first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2002. They contain correspondence, exhibition announcements, exhibition materials, memorial materials, an artist's statement, press clippings, newsletters, periodicals, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 2002-2008.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Michael Mitchell was born in 1952 in Chicago and studied at the Art Institute of Chicago. He worked primarily in figure drawings and was a storyboard illustrator for ad agencies. His work has been exhibited in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Michael Mitchell first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain correspondence, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, periodicals, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1996-2010.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Joseph Modica was born in 1946 in Staten Island, New York. He studied at the School of Visual Arts. His work in painting and photography has been exhibited in New York. He passed away in 2018.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Joseph Modica first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2004. They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, exhibition materials, correspondence, CDs with images of art, press releases, original drawings, photographic prints, poetry, original sketches, and 35mm slide documentation with accompanying image lists. These materials are dated 1996-2013.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Eric Molnar was born in 1950 in Manhattan, New York. He was educated at Parsons School of Design. He works primarily in oil and watercolor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Eric Molnar first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain correspondence, press clippings, calendar submission materials, artist's statements, photographic prints, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image lists. These materials are dated 1992-2012.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jorge Luis Moncayo was born in 1955 in Ecuador. He studied art in Guayaquil, Ecuador as a child and then at Marymount College and the Fashion Institute of Technology in New York after moving to the US at age 16. His artwork spans painting, fabric design, jewelry, and tapestry. It has been exhibited in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Jorge Luis Moncayo first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2003. They contain CDs with images of art, an artist's biography, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 2002-2005.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Bruce Monroe was born in 1956 in Roswell, New Mexico. He received a BS in Zoology from Texas A&M University and after a 20-year career in fundraising he received an MFA from the University of South Florida. His work in sculpture and photography is inspired by print-making and has been exhibited in Florida and Puerto Rico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bruce Monroe first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2010. They contain an artist's biography, an artist's statement, a CV, photographic prints, ephemera, and a CD with images of art and accompanying image list. These materials are dated 2008-2010.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Joe Monroe was born in 1959 in Hoopeston, Illinois. He studied art at Illinois State University and moved to San Francisco and later Los Angeles to pursue painting and art. His work has been exhibited across the country and he has worked with various HIV organization to help raise money with his art. He describes his work as "naive whimsical pop art".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Joe Monroe first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2000. They contain exhibition announcements, artwork on postcards, correspondence, ephemera, artwork on flyers, CVs, calendars with art, photographic prints, artist's biographies, press clippings, periodicals, newsletters, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, image lists, CDs with images of art, floppy disks, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1991-2013.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Ronald Bruce Monroe was born in 1939 in Quincy, Massachusetts. He was educated at Harvard and Columbia Universities but received no formal art training. His mixed media box constructions were inspired by artist Joseph Cornell. He passed away in 1990.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Ronald Bruce Monroe were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997 by Ronald Smith. They contain exhibition announcements, an artist's biography and statement, list of artworks with statements, press clippings, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1969-2004.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Frank Moore was born in 1953 in New York. He was educated at Yale College and Cite des Arts in Paris. He moved to SoHo in 1977. He was a painter, illustrator, set designer, costumer designer, and activist. As an early member of Visual AIDS he was instrumental in helping create the Red Ribbon Project. His work has been widely exhibited in the US and internationally. His papers are in the collection at Fales Library at NYU. He passed away in 2002.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Frank Moore first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain press clippings, memorial materials, press releases, photographic prints, exhibition announcements, correspondence, exhibition catalogs, periodicals, CVs, artist's statements, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1988-2012.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Michael P. Moore was born in 1964 in Oceanside, California. He has been creating digital art since 1987, using his sculpting experience to create a pseudo 3-D multi-media style. He also creates prints, drawings, photography, and sculpture. His work has been exhibited across the US.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Michael P Moore first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2000. They contain exhibition materials, correspondence, artist's statements, CVs, an artist's biography, image lists, calendar submission materials, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 2000-2004.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Mike Moreno was born in 1957. He has been making art and developing community art projects for our 35 years, as well as working as teacher, community organizer, and activist. His artwork is inspired by traveling carnivals and circuses as well as his own New Mexican heritage. His medium of choice is mixed media sculpture. His work has been exhibited across the country. He lives and works in New Mexico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Mike Moreno contain a CV.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Michael C. Morgan was born in 1955 in Charlotte, North Carolina. He earned a BFA from Atlanta College of Art and later taught art classes to youth and adults. His paintings have been exhibited around the Atlanta area.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Michael C Morgan first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2005. They contain a CD with images of art, an artist's statement, an artist's biography, a CV, and 35mm slide documentation of art. There materials are dated 2005.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Reto Morger was born in 1968 in Mexico City, Mexico. He received a BA from La Universidad de Periodismo y Arte en Radio y Televisión in Mexico City. He works primarily in painting and sculpture and has been exhibited in Mexico and New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reto Morger first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2003. The collection includes a CV. The materials are dated 2003.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Ricardo Morin was born in 1954 in Venezuela. He received a BFA from SUNY Buffalo and an MFA from Yale University. He has worked as a set designer as well as a painter in various mediums. His work has been exhibited in New York and surrounding areas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ricardo Morin first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain CDs with images of art, exhibition catalogs, photographic prints, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, correspondence, artist's statements, image lists, CVs, artist's biographies, press clippings, periodicals, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image lists. These materials dated 1974-2003.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: John Morrison was born in 1961 and moved to New York at age 19. He began to pursue photography while taking a class on interior design. His photographs document the club scene and queer community in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: John Morrison first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2001. They contain correspondence, a zine, ephemera, correspondence, image lists, artist's statements, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1996-2012.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Mark Morrisroe was born in 1959 in Malden, Massachusetts. He attended the School of the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston where he made friends with several other artists and graduated with honors. He was a performance artist and photographer in the punk scene in Boston and New York. His photographs were mostly portraits and were often inscribed with comments, biographical notes, and dedications. His work has been exhibited internationally. He passed away in 1989.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Mark Morrisroe include exhibition announcements, exhibition programs, a curatorial statement, photocopies of zines, exhibition materials, press clippings, CVs, image lists, academic writings, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1976-2015.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Leroy Morvant was born in 1966 in New Orleans, Louisiana. He works primarily in painting as well as sculpture. His work has been exhibited in California and Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Leroy Morvant first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2005. They contain CVs, correspondence, an artist's biography, image lists, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 2004-2006.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Nicolas Moufarrege was born in 1947 in Alexandria, Egypt. He received undergraduate and graduate degrees in chemistry from the American University of Beirut, Lebanon in 1965 and 1968, respectively. In 1968 he moved to Cambridge, Massachusetts on a Fulbright Grant and a Harvard University assistantship, during which time he decided to pursue a career in the arts. He moved to New York City in 1981 and became a central figure in the burgeoning East Village arts scene. His artworks were hybrids of painting and embroidery, some as large as five feet. His work has been exhibited widely in New York and elsewhere. He passed away in 1985.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Nicolas Moufarrege donated to the Visual AIDS archive contain a CD with images of art, exhibition programs, press clippings, press releases, exhibition materials, artist's biographies, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1980-2020.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Abdul-Aliy A. Muhammad was born in 1983 in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. He is a writer, poet, activist, and photographer and is deeply connected to Black cultural production of the 1990s and 2000s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Abdul-Aliy A Muhammad donated to the Visual AIDS archive contain postcards of art and poetry books. These materials are dated 2018-2021.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jesse Murry was born in 1948 in Fayetteville, North Carolina. He studied at Sarah Lawrence College in Bronxville, New York, and Yale University in New Haven, Connecticut. He moved to New York, living in SoHo, and later in the West Village. He worked primarily in oil and beeswax, as well as watercolor. In addition to being an artist he was an art history professor and art critic. He passed away in 1993.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Jesse Murry include exhibition catalogs. These materials are dated 2019.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jon Nalley was born in 1959 in Honolulu, Hawai'i. He was educated at Michigan State University. A lifelong photographer, his work as an artist led him to queer activism. He has traveled internationally and his photography has been exhibited in New York and surrounding areas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Jon Nalley first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2012. They contain a CD with images of art, an artist's statement, and a CV. These materials are dated 2012.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Gladys Natal was born in 1962 in Brooklyn, New York. She paints with acrylic, often depicting flowers and nature. Her work has been exhibited in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gladys Natal first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2001. They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, correspondence, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1999-2001.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Robert Nathans was born in 1955 in Patterson, New Jersey. He studied art at Pratt Institute and Art Students League in New York, as well as the University of South Florida. His work is primarily in painting and printmaking. It has been exhibited in New York, Florida, and California.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Robert Nathans first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2006. They contain a CD with images of art, exhibition announcements, exhibition catalogs, artist's statements, CVs, image lists, and periodicals. These materials are dated 1996-2008.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Ray Navarro was born in 1964. He was an artist, filmmaker, and activist from Simi Valley, California. He attended CalArts before moving to New York in 1988 to attend Whitney Independent Studies Program. He was a member of ACT-UP and DIVA TV, a video-documenting affinity group within it. He also collaborated with artist Zoe Leonard to produce photographic work after losing his sight to CMV retinitis. He passed away in 1990.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Ray Navarro include an exhibition announcement.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: David Nelson was born in 1960. He moved to New York in the 70's and started to make art, later receiving his BFA from the School of Visual Arts in New York. Nelson was an avid collector and made art with found objects. He also used those objects to create photograms. His work has been exhibited in New York and internationally. He passed away in 2013.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: David Nelson first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain exhibition announcements, correspondence, interviews, image lists, press releases, memorial materials, artist's statements, CVs, exhibition materials, an exhibition catalog, a CD with images of art, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1995-2015.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Luis Felipe Nieves was born in 1963 in Puerto Rico. He works primarily in sculpture and painting.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Luis Felipe Nieves first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2012. They contain correspondence and grant application materials. These materials are dated 2012.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jose Nieves-Rosado was born in 1972 in Italy. He studied Latin American literature at New York University. He works primarily in painting, sculpture, and installation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Jose Nieves-Rosado first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2003. They contain 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 2003.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Robert Ordonez was born in 1972 in Brownsville, Texas. He studied photography at the International Center of Photography. His interests lie in street and fashion photography. He has self-published a book of his art.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Robert Ordonez first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2012. They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, ephemera, an artist's biography, and a CV. These materials are dated 2011-2012.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Luna Luis Ortiz was born in 1972 in New York City. He was educated at the School of Visual Arts. He flourished as a photographer in the New York ballroom, voguing, and club kid scene. He taught photography at Harvey Milk High School, and became a spokesperson for HIV awareness, later working for GMHC. His work has been exhibited widely and featured in various publications.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Luna Luis Ortiz first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain exhibition announcements, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, press clippings, CVs, periodicals, photographs, press releases, correspondence, an artist's biography, ephemera, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1990-2008.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Sam Orwen was born in 1957 in Beatrice, Nebraska and began making art as a small child. He received a BFA in art, but considered himself a self-taught artist. His work has been exhibited across the US. He passed away in 2001.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sam Orwen first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2000. They contain artist's biographies, artist's statements, a CV, correspondence, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1981-2000.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: John Painter was born in 1951 in Lake Charles, Louisiana. He was educated at McNeese State University and Glassell School of Art. A painter, he works primarily with wet-on-wet application of acrylic on canvas. His work has been exhibited in Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: John Painter first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2005. They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, an artist's statement, an artist's biography, a CV, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 2005-2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Justine Paratore was born in 1966 in Paraibe, Brazil and was raised on Long Island, New York. She began drawing and painting at a young age and works in acrylic, watercolor, pastel, and mixed media. Over 150 of her works are held in private collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Justine Paratore first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2000. They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, correspondence, an artist's biography, and polaroids. These materials are dated 1999-2000.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Mike Parker was born in 1957 in Capistrano Beach, California. He began making art as a child and learned basic technique at his local community college. He moved to New York in 1981 and continued painting, inspired by his upbringing and relationship to surfing. His work has been exhibited in New York and California.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mike Parker first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain correspondence, ephemera, press clippings, a CV, image lists, an artist's biography, photocopies of art, photographic prints of art, exhibition announcements, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1985-1998.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Robert Miles Parker was born in 1939 in Norfolk, Virginia. He studied at the College of William and Mary, in Williamsburg, Virginia, and San Diego State University. He was an artist and preservationist whose art included whimsical pen-and-ink drawings of urban landscapes. His work was exhibited and published widely. He passed away in 2012.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Robert Miles Parker first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain correspondence, exhibition announcements, artwork on postcards, CVs, artist's statements, image lists, press clippings, calendar submission materials, original artworks, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1991-2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Phillip Patterson was born in 1950 in Queens, New York. He received a BFA from the New York School of Interior Design. He worked as an interior designer for many years before coming to scribe and book arts. Much of his work involves working closely with the Bible as a way to interrogate his own relationship with spirituality.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phillip Patterson first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2010. They contain CDs with images of art, an artist's statement, original artwork on paper, and press clippings. These materials are dated 2009-2010.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Hermes Payrhuber was born in 1969 in Vienna, Austria. His work in photography, collage, sculpture, and installation work has been exhibited internationally since the early 90s and is held in a number of permanent collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Hermes Payrhuber first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2007. They contain exhibition announcements, CDs with images of art, publications, CVs, essays, press releases, an exhibition catalog, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 2002-2016.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Christopher Peel was born in 1953 in Nottingham, England. He studied at the City and Guilds of London Institute. He works primarily in paintings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Christopher Peel first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2009. They contain a CD with images of art, correspondence, and an artist's biography. These materials are dated 2009.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Marc Pelletier was born in 1957 in Lewiston, Maine. He received a BFA from the University of Southern Maine and an MFA from Syracuse University. He also studied in the UK. His work includes drawing, painting, and printmaking. He also began making collages when he moved to New York in 1983. His work has been exhibited in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Marc Pelletier first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2006. They contain exhibition materials, a CD with images of art, an artist's statement, a CV, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 2001-2012.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Daniel L. Perry was born in 1959 in Ann Arbor, Michigan. He began painting at an early age and has worked as a freelance painter, a set designer, and graphic designer. His colorful paintings span landscape, portrait, and abstraction. His work has been exhibited in a variety of settings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Daniel L. Perry first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2003. They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, correspondence, photocopies of artwork, photographic prints of artwork, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 2003-2006.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Grahame Perry was born in 1959 in London and came to the US when he was young. He received a BA from the University of California Berkeley and later returned to school for an AS in Photography. His work spans street photography, urban landscapes, community events, and night photography. It has been exhibited in California. He passed away in 2015.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Grahame Perry donated to the Visual AIDS archive include an artist's statement, exhibition materials, and a price list. These materials are dated 2010-2015.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: David Pibel was born in 1934. He served as a Marine and later a member of the Peace Corps and worked as an educator for many years. He is a sculptor, working primarily in woodcarving.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to David Pibel include artist's biographies and correspondence. These materials are dated 2017-2021.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Hattie Powell was born in 1946 in Florida. Her work is primarily in painting, which she has exhibited at the Jewish Board Art Show annually. She lives in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Hattie Powell first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2000. They consist of an artist's biography and press clippings. These materials are dated 2000.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Fitzgerald Providence was born in 1959. He studied at School of Visual Arts. He has been a facilitator at GMHC since 2016, helping others make art. His work has been exhibited in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Fitzgerald Providence include Postcards from the Edge submission materials. This material is undated.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Ronnie Queenan was born in 1954 in Lubbock, Texas. He studied at Texas Southern University and Glassell School of Art. A painter, he worked primarily with landscapes and abstraction. He passed away in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ronnie Queenan first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2006. They contain correspondence, cards with original paintings, CDs with images of art, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, an artist's statement, publications, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 2003-2013.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jolanta Rakouska was born in 1961 in Poland. She is a self-taught artist and primarily works in painting.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Jolanta Rakouska first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2000. They contain photographs, exhibition price lists, an artist's biography, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1999-2002.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Chuck Ramirez was born in 1962 in San Antonio, Texas. His work spans photography as well as graphic design and advertising. He was a central part of the San Antonio art community and his work was collected by the Smithsonian American Art Museum in 2012. He passed away in 2010.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Chuck Ramirez were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 2012 by Patricia Ruiz-Healy. They contain a CD with images of art, ephemera, correspondence, and an artist's biography. These materials are dated 2012.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Luis Ramirez was born in 1970. He received a BA in Interior Design and a masters from the Sustainable Environments program at the Fashion Institute of Technology in New York. His practice spans digital and classical art, photography, painting, sculpture, collage, and installation, as well as historical restoration and preservation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Luis Ramirez first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2009. They contain an artist's biography and a CD with images of art.These materials are dated 2009.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Robert Reed was born in 1961 in Searcy, Arkansas. His work includes painting, sculpture, performance, mixed media, and installation. It has been exhibited in New York and Boston.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Robert Reed first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain photographs of art, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, CVs, press clippings, correspondence, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1995-1998.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Richard Renaldi was born in 1968 in Chicago, Illinois. He received a BA in photography from New York University. His photography has been exhibited across the US and internationally. His work has been published in six monographs, among other publications.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Richard Renaldi first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2003. They contain correspondence, exhibition announcements, ephemera, CVs, press clippings, periodicals, photographic prints of art, press releases, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 2000-2012.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: David Reyes was born in 1954 in Trinidad. He came to the United States in the 1970s and studied art at the American Musical and Dramatic Academy in New York. He works in painting, illustration, and mixed media.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: David Reyes first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain correspondence, calendar submission materials, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image lists. These materials are dated 1998-2001.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Hunter Reynolds was born in 1959 in Rochester, Minnesota. He was an artist and AIDS activist. As an early member of ACT-UP he cofounded a sub-group within it called Art Positive. His artwork spans photography, performance, and installation work. His work has been exhibited widely in the US and internationally and is housed in numerous public and private collections. He passed away in 2022.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Hunter Reynolds first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2002. They contain postcards of artwork, exhibition announcements, exhibition programs, exhibition catalogs, correspondence, ephemera, press releases, press clippings, periodicals, publications, an exhibition book, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1990-2015.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Eric Rhein was born in 1961 and raised in the Hudson Valley. He received both a BFA and MFA from the School of Visual Arts in New York. He is an activist and has worked with Visual AIDS since the mid-1990s. He works primarily in wire drawings, sculpture, mixed media collage, and photography and often includes salvaged materials. His work has been exhibited internationally and reviews of his work have appeared in numerous publications.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Eric Rhein first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain exhibition announcements, CDs with images of art, correspondence, CVs, artist's statements, press releases, press clippings, publications, calendar submission materials, exhibition proposals, image lists, ephemera, images of art, an exhibition poster, exhibition programs, exhibition catalogs, periodicals, a CD with images of art, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1989-2015.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Drake Richardson was born in 1963 in New York. He studied art and design in high school and college. He works primarily in pencil and charcoal drawings. He lives in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Drake Richardson first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2000. They contain artist's biographies, an artist's statement, and grant application materials. These materials are dated 2000.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Herb Ritts was born in 1952. He began his photographic career in the late 1970s and became well known as an art and commercial photographer. His commercial work has appeared in numerous publications and his art photography has been exhibited internationally. It is held in many private and public collections. He passed away in 2002.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Herb Ritts include periodicals. These materials are dated 1996-2003.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jose Rivera was born in 1968 in Brooklyn, New York. He works primarily in painting and illustration. He lives in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Jose Rivera first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2002. They contain correspondence and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1998-2003.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Juan Rivera was born in 1957 in New Haven, Connecticut. He lived most of his life in New York. His photographs document the New York cultural scene in the 1980s, including his relationship with Keith Haring. He also worked in illustration. He wrote a book about his life in 2007 and passed away in 2011.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Juan Rivera first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain an artist's biography, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1985-1998.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Alexander Robateau was born in 1964 in Belize. He works primarily in painting — mostly portrait, still-life, and murals — as well as wallpaper and fabric design. He lives and works in the Bronx.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Alexander Robateau donated to the Visual AIDS archive contain images of artwork and ephemera. These materials are dated 2017.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Daniel Roberts was born in 1957 in Newton, Kansas. He received a BFA from Kansas State University. His work includes sculpture, painting, and mixed media work. His work has been exhibited in New York and Florida.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Daniel Roberts first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1999. They contain a CD with images of art, correspondence, ephemera, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, exhibition programs, CVs, slide lists, artist's statements, exhibition announcements, poster of artwork, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1991-2023.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Sandy Lee Robertson was born in 1946 in North Carolina. He received a BS in Studio Arts from Winston Salem State University and an MA in art and education from Miami University. He primarily works in painting and drawings and has been exhibited in North Carolina and New York. He has also worked as an art educator.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sandy Lee Robertson first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2004. They include correspondence, photographic prints, exhibition announcements, an artist's biography, press clippings, CVs, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1978-2010.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Nevin Robinson was born in 1962 in Illinois. He received a BA in cinema and photography from Southern Illinois University and an MFA in photography from San Francisco Art Institute. He has been a photographer since childhood and has exhibited work in the US and internationally.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Nevin Robinson first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2003. They contain exhibition announcements, ephemera, CVs, image lists, artist's statements, press clippings, periodicals, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1998-2008.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Abnel Rodriguez was born in 1964 in San Juan, Puerto Rico. He studied painting and drawing at the Art Students League of San Juan and the Luchetti School of Visual Arts. He later studied at Pratt Institute in New York and the University of Puerto Rico. He has worked in illustration, translation, design, and editing for Macmillan Publishing Co. His artwork spans a variety of media including painting, illustration, and photography and has been exhibited in New York and Puerto Rico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Abnel Rodriguez first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain a photograph of the artist, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, exhibition announcements, ephemera, exhibition programs, artist's statements, artist's biographies, CVs, press clippings, calendar submisson materials, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1994-1999.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Nelson Edwin Rodriguez was born in 1972 in Puerto Rico. His family moved to New York City and in 1990 he participated in a photography course at the Hetrick-Martin Institute alongside Milton Garcia Ninja and Luna Luis Ortiz. He was a photographer and performer. He passed away in 1995.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Nelson Rodriguez were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 2000 by Barbara Bickart. They contain event programs, exhibition announcements, correspondence, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image lists. These materials are dated 1993-1998.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Stephen Romano was born in 1957 in Boston, Massachusetts. He received a BFA from Parsons School of Design. He has worked in fashion, set design, interior design, and production for film.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Stephen Romano were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997 by Paula Romano. They contain correspondence, exhibition announcements, CVs, an image of the artist, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1991-1997.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: James Romberger was born in 1958 in Port Jefferson, New York. He studied at the Munson Williams Proctor Institute, School of Visual Arts, Borough of Manhattan Community College, Columbia University, and CUNY Graduate Center. His work spans pastel drawings, comics, installation, and film work, depicting life in the Lower East Side and his experiences living there. With Marguerite Van Cook, he published 7 Miles a Second, a graphic novel memoir written in collaboration with David Wojnarowicz. His work has been exhibited widely in New York and is held in many private collections. He lives in New York City.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: James Romberger first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2005. They contain exhibition announcements, CVs, press clippings, an artist's statement, copies of artwork, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1989-2021.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Dyke Rowntree was born in 1953 in Chickasha, Oklahoma. He received a BA in art. His work includes paintings, collage, textiles, and mixed media sculpture. He passed away in 1988.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Dyke Rowntree were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 2008 by Dala Rowntree. They contain correspondence and an artist's biography. These materials are dated 2008.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Craig Russell was born in 1953 in Illinois. He received a BS in graphic design from Illinois State University and a multimedia certificate from Pratt Institute. His works in painting, photography, collage, digital art, and video have been exhibited in New York. He passed away in 2019.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Craig Russell first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2004. They contain exhibition announcements, images of art, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, CVs, correspondence, excerpts from children's book, press clippings, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image lists. These materials are dated 1973-2013.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Gregory Russell was born in 1955 in Washington, DC. He holds a BFA and MFA from Maryland Institute College of Art. He works primarily in oil painting and has exhibited across the east coast of the US and in Zimbabwe. His art is informed by his experience in community social work.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gregory Russell first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, artist's statements, CVs, correspondence, press clippings, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1977-2013.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Rafael Sanchez was born in 1960 in Havana, Cuba. He studied at duCret School of the Arts and Rutgers University. His work includes painting, photography, sculpture, installation, film and theater, and digital art. It has been exhibited across the US and internationally.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rafael Sanchez first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2011. They contain poetry books, CVs, exhibition materials, a play program, and memorial materials. These materials are dated 2011-2016.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Phyllis Sanfiorenzo was born in 1959 in New York City. She studied at the Fashion Institute of Technology, New School, and School of Visual Arts. She works in painting and sculpture and has produced illustrations for theatre companies as well as public art.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phyllis Sanfiorenzo first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2015. They contain a CV and an exhibition announcement. These materials are dated 2015.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Carmine Santaniello was born in 1955 in New York. He studied at Parsons School of Design. He works in painting, print making, and collage and has exhibited in New York and internationally. His art has also been featured in many publications and is held in various permanent collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Carmine Santaniello first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2003. They contain correspondence, ephemera, exhibition announcements, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, artist's statements, CVs, artist's biographies, press releases, CDs with images of art, publications, periodicals, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image lists. These materials are dated 2001-2012.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Luis Tito Santos was born in 1961 in New York City. He is a self-taught artist and works in painting and illustration.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Luis Tito Santos first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2001. They contain an artist's statement, an artist's biography, and images of art. These materials are dated 2001.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Rene Santos was born in 1954 in Puerto Rico. He received a BFA from Tufts University and an MFA from Hunter College. His work in photography, collage, and paintings has been exhibited in New York as well as across the US, Puerto Rico, and Europe. He passed away in 1986.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Rene Santos were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997 by his mother. They contain correspondence, excerpts from essays, press releases, press clippings, periodicals, CVs, an exhibition catalog, image lists, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1979-2013.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: John Sapp was born in 1947. He received a BA from Tulane University in New Orleans, Louisiana, an MFA from the University of California Berkeley, and a JD from the University of Texas law school. He also studied painting and sculpture. He works in painting and illustration and has exhibited in Texas, California, and New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to John Sapp were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 2005 by Corliss Cavalieri. They contain artwork on postcards, correspondence, a CV and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1988-2005.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Richard Sawdon Smith was born in 1963 in England. He was educated in graphic design and photography and is a professor of photography at Norwich University of the Arts. He is an award-winning photographer whose work has been exhibited and published internationally.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Richard Sawdon Smith first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2004. They contain artwork on postcards, a CV, correspondence, slide lists, an artist's statement, exhibition announcements, periodicals, publications, photographic prints, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1990-2012.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Peter Schepper was born in 1964 in Albany, New York. He studied fine art and theatre at Texas State University and Del Mar College. His work includes painting, sculpture, collage, pen and ink drawing, and puppetry. It has been exhibited in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Peter Schepper first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2010. They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, exhibition announcements, an image list, a CV, correspondence, and artwork. These materials are dated 2009-2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Hal Scheppner's art included quilting, watercolor, and oil painting. He passed away in 2003.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Hal Scheppner were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 2004 by Georgianne Scheppner. They contain correspondence and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 2001-2005.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Adrienne Seed was born in 1949 in England. She received a BA in fine art from St Martin's University in London. Her work includes painting and sculpture. Her work has been exhibited internationally and is held in a number of private collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Adrienne Seed first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2009. They contain a CD with images of art, correspondence, a CV, an image list, a publication, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image lists. These materials are dated 1969-2009.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Andreas Senser was born in 1942 in Saint-Gallen, Switzerland. He travelled through the UK where he studied painting, watercolor technique, and education. He worked as a painting therapist in France. From 1973 to his death, he lived between New York and Paris, making collaged paper structures and paintings. He passed away in 1989.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Andreas Senser were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998 by Sur Rodney (Sur). They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, publications of artwork, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1982-1992.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Donna Sewell was born in 1962 in California. She studied at Chabot Jr College in Hayward, California. In addition to making art, she also spends time teaching art to disabled children.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Donna Sewell first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2002. They contain an artist's biography and an artist's statement. These materials are dated 2002.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Michael Sharkey was born in 1948 in Queens, New York. He received an associates degree in advertising design and a BA in fine arts. He worked in advertising for over 20 years. In 1997 he began to exhibit and sell his paintings. His paintings are inspired by impressionist art.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Michael Sharkey first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2002. They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, exhibition announcements, artist's biographies, artist's statements, photocopies of personal photographs, photocopies of photographs of art, and 35mm slide documentation with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1998-2012.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Tom Shooter was born in 1941 in Williamsport, Pennsylvania. He received a BFA from Tufts University, and both an MA and MFA from the School of the Museum of Fine Arts in Boston. He taught painting and painted prolifically for many years. His work was exhibited widely in Massachusetts as well as New York, DC, Pennsylvania, Connecticut, and Italy. He passed away in 2004.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tom Shooter first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2001. They contain exhibition catalogs, exhibition announcements, memorial materials, CVs, artist's statements, journal excerpts, photocopies of artwork, press releases, image lists, press clippings, photographic prints, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image lists. These materials are dated 1975-2004.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Tracy Karl Silverberg was born in 1966 in Houston, Texas. He studied theatre, communications, journalism, advertising, and photography. His work is primarily in black and white photography. It has been exhibited in Texas and Georgia. He passed away in 2005.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tracy Karl Silverberg first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2005. They contain a CV, an artist's biography, an artist's statement, a death certificate, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 2004-2005.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: James "Jimmie Mack" Simmonds was born in 1948 in Wahoo, Nebraska and lived in Omaha for most of his life. He was a self-taught artist who used weaving and found materials to create "spirit baskets". His work was inspired by his grandmother Jose, an Iowa Sioux, who taught him how to weave baskets. His work was exhibited in Nebraska. He passed away in 2008.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: James "Jimmie Mack" Simmonds first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2001. They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, correspondence, newsletters, artist's biographies, artist's statements, articles, image lists, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 2000-2006.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Ted Singer was born in 1957 in Patterson, New Jersey. His work includes illustration and collage.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ted Singer first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2000. They contain an artist's biography and correspondence. These materials are dated 2000.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Ron Singleton was born in 1958 in Detroit, Michigan. He is a self-taught photographer who began to pursue photography after 15 years in law. His work has appeared in various queer publications and has been exhibited in California and New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ron Singleton first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2001. They contain a CV, an artist's biography, an artist's statement, and an exhibition announcement. These materials are dated 2001.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Michael Slocum was born in 1956. He was a comic artist, writer, activist, and editor of People with AIDS Coalition Newsline, a monthly magazine. His comic "Zander Alexander, PWA" appeared in Newsline from 1993 until his death in 1995.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Michael Slocum were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain exhibition announcements, copies of PWAC Newsline, ephemera, an artist's biography, a curator's statement, copies of comics illustrations, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1993-2021.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Clifford Smith was born in 1955 in Havelock, North Carolina and grew up in Michigan and Southern California. In the late 1970s and 80s he was a professional dancer. In the 1990s he taught himself art and began making hand-woven creations and other mixed media work, which took inspiration from mandalas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Clifford Smith first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1999. They contain a CD with images of art, ephemera, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, photographic prints, exhibition announcements, a marriage announcement, a book of poetry, exhibition programs, artist's statements, correspondence, image lists, calendar submission materials, press release, artist's biographies, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1995-2016.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jack Smith was born in 1932. He lived and worked in New York from the 1950s until his death. He was a filmmaker, actor, and pioneer of underground cinema. He is generally acclaimed as a founding father of American performance art. His influence extends across photography and experimental theatre as well. He passed away in 1989.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Jack Smith donated to the Visual AIDS archive contain exhibition announcements, ephemera, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1996-2014.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Huck Snyder was born in 1954 in Lansdale, Pennsylvania. He studied at the College of William and Mary in Virginia and the Goethe Institute in Berlin. He was a visual artist and a designer of vivid stage settings for dancers and performance artists. His work was surrealist and imaginative. His work has been displayed widely in the US, Europe, and Japan, and has won many awards. He passed away in 1993.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Huck Snyder includes an undated artist's biography.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Thomas R. Somerville was born in 1960 in Rochester, New York. He studied at San Diego City College and received a BS, an MS in painting and poetry, and an MS in art education from Rochester Institute of Technology. His paintings have been featured in various publications and exhibited in California and New York and one of his pieces traveled the country in the Share Your Vision exhibition.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Thomas R. Somerville first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2003. They contain artwork on postcards, ephemera, a calendar with artwork, books with photographs of artwork, exhibition catalog, correspondence, press clippings, an exhibition announcements, CVs, artist's statements, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 2002-2010.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Harry Soviak was born in 1935 in Lorain, Ohio. He received both bachelors and masters degrees in painting from Cranbrook Academy of Art in Bloomfield Hills, Michigan. He taught painting and drawing in Haiti for a time, and later moved to New York City, working in the textile industry. He worked at the Philadelphia College of the Arts in various capacities until his death. His paintings were exhibited widely across the US. He passed away in 1984.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Harry Soviak donated to the Visual AIDS archive contain ephemera, photographs of artwork, exhibition materials, correspondence, exhibition catalogs, a CV, and curatorial statements. These materials are dated 1985-1996.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Matti Kniva Spencer was born in 1952 in Lewiston, Maine. He received a BS in education from the University of Maine. He worked as a preschool teacher for 13 years before switching to human service work. He was a photographer from a young age and began pursuing professional photography in 2000. His work has been exhibited in Massachusetts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Matti Kniva Spencer first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2003. They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, photographic prints, correspondence, press clippings, exhibition announcements, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 2003-2019.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: David Spiher was born in 1958 in Washington, DC. He received a BFA from Indiana University and an MFA from Ohio State University. His work spans illustration and painting, as well as hand-painted ceramic plates. He lives and works in Hawai'i.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: David Spiher first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain exhibition announcements, correspondence, CDs with images of art, CVs, image lists, calendar submission materials, press clippings, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1992-2006.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Joseph Stabilito was born in 1955. He studied at Tyler College of Art, the Art Institute of Philadelphia, and the School of Visual Arts in New York. His paintings are made with layers of acrylic paint, creating bold images. His work has been exhibited in New York, Chicago, and internationally.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Joseph Stabilito first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain correspondence, images of art, artist's statements, CVs, image lists, calendar submission materials, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1995-2003.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Maxime Angel was born in 1977 in Rome, Italy. Her work includes large-scale mixed media collage and performance work. She began performing after moving to London in the late 1990s. Her work has been exhibited in Berlin and London.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Maxime Angel Starling include a copy of an undated online publication.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Mike Stead was born in 1976 in Hartlepool, England and grew up in various countries including Germany, China, and Thailand. He was educated at Edinburgh College of Art and Cleveland College of Art and Design. His work spans painting and printmaking as well as graphic novels. His work has been exhibited widely in England and in the US.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mike Stead first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2012. They contain artist's statements and CVs. These materials are dated 2012.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Hugh Steers was born in 1962 in Washington, DC. He studied art at Skowhegan School of Painting and Sculpture, Yale University, and Parsons School of Design. His figurative paintings worked to capture the emotional and political tenor of New York in the 1980s and 90s. His work was exhibited widely in New York and across the US. He passed away in 1995 in New York City.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Hugh Steers were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998 by Jay Swanson. They contain a CD with images of art, memorial materials, exhibition announcements, correspondence, proposals, artist's statements, CVs, bibliographies, inventories, writing about artist, press clippings, press releases, schedules, photocopies of personal materials, photographic prints of art, eulogies, exhibition catalogs, periodicals, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1990-2016.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Patric Stillman was born in 1962 in Shakopee, Minnesota. He works primarily in painting and he is known for his Radical Faerie-themed Brotherhood Tarot. His work has been exhibited internationally and appeared in various publications. He lives and works in San Diego, California.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Patric Stillman donated to the Visual AIDS archive contain a CD with images of art and an exhibition announcement. These materials are dated 2017.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Juan C. Suazo was born in 1963 in San Juan, Puerto Rico. His work spans sculpture and craft, particularly the creation of masks. His art has been exhibited in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Juan C. Suazo first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2011. They contain a CD with images of art with accompanying image list, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, an exhibition announcement, ephemera, and press releases. These materials are dated 2007-2013.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Gekoo Surlee was born in 1968 in North Pond, Nusantara in Indonesia. He moved to New York in 1998. His work includes oil, watercolor, and acrylic painting, as well as mixed media work incorporating recycled materials. His work was exhibited in Nusantara and New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gekoo Surlee first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain correspondence, an artist's biography, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1998.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: JD Talasek was born in 1966 in Dallas, Texas. He received a BS from East Texas State University and an MFA from the University of Delaware. He also studied at the Prague School of Photographic Studies. His work is primarily in photography and has been exhibited and published widely across the US.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: JD Talasek first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain correspondence, ephemera, exhibition announcements, CVs, press releases, press clippings, artist's statements, calendar submission materials, artist's biographies, publications, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1998-2003.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Tim Tate was born in 1960 in Washington, DC. He works primarily in sculpture and glasswork. He co-founded the Washington Glass School and his work has been shown nationally and internationally since the 1990s. His work is also held in permanent collections around the US.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tim Tate first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2006. They contain a CV, an image list, a periodical, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 2005-2007.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Luis Tavales was born in 1958 in Queens, New York. He is a self-taught artist working in painting and digital arts. His work has been exhibited in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Luis Tavales first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2010. They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, correspondence, ephemera, CDs with images of art, exhibition announcements, artist's biographies, CVs, and image lists. These materials are dated 2008-2012.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Steed Taylor was born in 1959 in Cumberland County, North Carolina. He received a BA in English and studio art from the University of North Carolina and an MBA in marketing from American University. He also studied at the Skowhegan School for Painting and Sculpture. His art practice spans public art projects as well as work for gallery settings, including painting, photography, sculpture, and more. His art has been exhibited widely in the US. He has also worked in AIDS activism for many years. He lives and works in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Steed Taylor first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, ephemera, exhibition announcements, correspondence, photobooks of art, artist's statements, press releases, press clippings, CVs, publications, calendar submission materials, photocopies of art, image lists, exhibition materials, portfolios, periodicals, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying slide list. These materials are dated 1964-2013.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Tom Teebe was born in 1946 in Brooklyn, New York. He studied at the American Academy of Dramatic Arts. He also studied drawing and oil painting at the 92nd St Y. He works primarily in portraiture, using oil, pastel, conte, and charcoal. His work has been exhibited in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tom Teebe first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1999. They contain correspondence, ephemera, photographs of art, artist's biographies, an artist's statement, calendar submission materials, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1998-2001.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Joey Terrill was born in 1955 in Los Angeles, California. He studied at Immaculate Heart College and Cal State University Los Angeles. He draws inspiration from cartoons, comics, magazines, pop culture, and artistic movements of the 1950s and 60s. His art is often related to his activism around AIDS and Chicano social justice efforts. His work has been exhibited widely in California and New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Joey Terrill first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2007. They contain exhibition announcements, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, ephemera, press clippings, CVs, artist's statements, image lists, copies of zines, exhibition catalogs, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1988-2023.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Paul Thek was born in 1933 in Brooklyn, New York. He studied at Pratt Institute, the Art Students League, and Cooper Union. Though he began as a painter, he became known for his sculptures and installations. His work has been exhibited widely internationally and remains in various permanent collections. He passed away in 1988.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Paul Thek were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997 by Ted Bonin. They contain exhibition announcements, CVs, press clippings, press releases, scans of journal pages and illustration, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1964-2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Keith Theriot was born in 1960 in Louisiana. He received a BFA from Louisiana State University. His work includes painting and mixed media and has been exhibited widely across the US.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Keith Theriot first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2004. They contain exhibition announcements, correspondence, ephemera, a CD with images of art, an image list, CVs, artist's statements, press clippings, periodicals, and photographs of artwork. These materials are dated 2004-2008.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Michael Tidmus was born in 1951 in Toronto, Canada. He works primarily in painting and digital art. His art has been exhibited across California, New York, and elsewhere in the US. He taught photography and computer graphics in California. He passed away in 2012.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Michael Tidmus first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2008. They contain a CV, an article, correspondence, and images of artwork. These materials are dated 1993-2008.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Thomas TRET Tierney was born in 1960 in the Bronx, New York. He was received a BFA from Pratt Institute. His work includes photography, collage, and mixed media work and has been exhibited widely in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Thomas TRET Tierney first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, exhibition announcements, correspondence, artwork on postcards, publications, artist's statements, press clippings, CVs, copies of reviews, artist's biographies, exhibition proposals, calendar submission materials, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image lists. These materials are dated 1995-2010.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: William Lincoln Tisdale was born in 1964. He received a BFA at the Art Institute of Boston. His work spans painting, collage, and mixed media. It was exhibited widely in Massachusetts and is held in various permanent collections. He passed away in 1996.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to William Lincoln Tisdale were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 2000 by Cynthia von Buhler. They contain an artist's statement, press clippings, a CV, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1989-2000.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Hector Toscano was born in 1974 in Buenos Aires, Argentina. He works in painting and photography and has exhibited internationally. He lives in France.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Hector Toscano first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2008. They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, ephemera, a CV, correspondence, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1998-2008.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
