bioghist.p: George Towne was born in 1968 in Northeast Pennsylvania. He received both a BFA and an MFA from the School of Visual Arts. He works in painting as well as printmaking and collage, often depicting landscapes, cityscapes, and portraiture. His art has been exhibited widely in New York and published nationally.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: George Towne first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2005. They contain exhibition announcements, CVs, press clippings, correspondence, images of art, periodicals, publications, exhibition catalogs, CDs with images of art, image lists, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1997-2012.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Richard Treitner was born in 1965. He received a BFA from Jersey City State College. He works in photography, painting, and mixed media. His work has been exhibited since he was 17, primarily in New York City.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Richard Treitner first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain exhibition announcements, correspondence, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, a poetry book, CVs, artist's statements, press clippings, calendar submission materials, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image lists. These materials are dated 1987-2005.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Benjamin Trimmier was born in 1955 in Mobile, Alabama. He received a BFA from Memphis College of Art and an MFA from Parsons School of Design. He works primarily in painting and has been exhibited widely in New York and Alabama.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Benjamin Trimmier first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain exhibition announcements, images of artwork, CVs, artist's statements, press releases, calendar submission materials, press clippings, periodicals, an exhibition program, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1994-2003.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Becky Trotter was born in 1968 in Forest City, North Carolina. Her work includes painting and printmaking. She served as the editor of People with AIDS Coalition/NY Newsline and worked with Visual AIDS in the late 1990s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Becky Trotter first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain photographic prints of art, exhibition announcements, correspondence, artist's statements, photocopies of artwork, publications, calendar submission materials, periodicals, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1994-2004.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Christopher Trujillo was born in 1969 in Santa Fe, New Mexico. He received BAs from Arizona State University and Al Collins Graphic Design School. A painter, he also worked as an interior designer for a number of years. His art has been exhibited in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Christopher Trujillo first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2001. They contain artwork on postcards, correspondence, a CV, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1987-2006.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: M. Turgeon was born in 1966 in Hartford, Connecticut. He studied photography at the School of Visual Arts. He works in painting, photography, and digital art and has exhibited in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: M. Turgeon first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2012. They contain a CD with images of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 2011-2012.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Osman Tyner was born in 1932 in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. In 1951 he moved to New York where he danced for Alvin Ailey before turning his focus to visual arts and design. He went on to make cartoons for the 45th Armored Battalion of the US Army and became head of the sign painting department. He later worked as an illustrator for Rights and Review magazine, allowing his work to reach a much wider audience. He passed away in 1993.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Osman Tyner were donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998 by Anthony Archibald J. They contain correspondence, an artist's biography, a CV, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1982-1998.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Peter Urban was born in 1948 in Jersey City, New Jersey. He received a BA from Boston University and studied art at the New England School of Photography, the Cambridge Center for Adult Education, and the Electronic Imaging Center. He was an artist and commercial photographer in Boston for many years. He also worked in silkscreen, digital art, and acrylic. His work was exhibited in Massachusetts and Toronto. He passed away in 2009.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Peter Urban first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain photographic prints, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, exhibition announcements, CD with images of art and accompanying image list, ephemera, artist's statements, CVs, correspondence, calendar submission materials, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1996-2007.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Marguerite Van Cook was born in 1954 in Portsmouth, England. After playing in a punk band in the UK she came to New York and opened the gallery, Ground Zero, with her partner, James Romberger, becoming part of the 1980s East Village art scene in the 1980s. Her writing, film, and visual art has been published widely and exhibited internationally. She holds a BA and MA from Columbia University and a PhD in French from CUNY Graduate Center. She lives in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Marguerite Van Cook first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2003. They contain exhibition announcements, poetry books, an artist's statement, CVs, periodicals, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1991-2021.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jeff Van Dyke was born in 1953 in Beech Grove, Indiana. He is an acupuncturist and artist who has been working in both disciplines for forty years. His mixed media paintings are influenced by Greek art and Southwestern pottery. He has exhibited in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Jeff Van Dyke first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2008. They contain a CD with images of art with accompanying image list, and an artist's statement. These materials are dated 2007-2008.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Johann Van Wyk was born in 1957 in South Africa. He received an associates degree in jewelry design from the Fashion Institute of Technology. His jewelry has appeared in various publications and is in the collection of the Smithsonian Museum. He was also a photographer and exhibited in Venezuela and New York. He passed away in 2015.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Johann Van Wyk first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2000. They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, correspondence, a CV, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1984-2013.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Carlos Vanegas was born in 1962 in Riohacha, La Guajira, Colombia. He studied journalism at the University of the Sabana in Bogota before moving to Spain to study and work in television production. After his arrival in the US he focused his artwork on a combination of imagery and narrative text. His work includes photography, painting, and mixed media and has been featured in publications internationally. He also wrote an autobiography entitled "The Man of the Red Shoes."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Carlos Vanegas first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2006. They contain CDs with images of art, ephemera, exhibition announcements, artist's biographies, an artist's statement, and correspondence. 2006-2013.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Eduardo Vanzini was born in 1957. He works in painting, photography, illustration, printmaking, and digital art.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Eduardo Vanzini include Postcards from the Edge submission materials. This material is undated.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Stephen Varble was born in 1946. He received a BA in English from the University of Kentucky and an MFA in Film from Columbia University. He was a performance artist, playwright, and fashion designer who was a fixture of the streets of SoHo in the 1970s. His practice was aimed at disruption - of commerce, of gender roles, and of institutions of art. His work was performed and exhibited widely. He passed away in 1984.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Stephen Varble were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997 by Geoffrey Hendricks. They contain exhibition announcements, an artist's biography, artist's statements, press clippings, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1972-1997.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jose Vasquez was born in 1968 in New York and raised in the Lower East Side. He learned how to draw and became interested in arts and crafts while incarcerated. He works primarily in illustration.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Jose Vasquez first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2000. They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, correspondence, an artist's biography, and original illustration. These materials are dated 2000.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Wilmer Velez was born in Ponce, Puerto Rico and moved to New York in 1989. He studied design at the Fashion Institute of Technology and the School of Visual Arts. His work includes painting, sculpture, and collage. It has been exhibited across the US, including as part of Day With(out) Art exhibitions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wilmer Velez first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, exhibition announcements, an exhibition program, a CV, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image lists. These materials are dated 1994-2008.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Ivan Vera was born in 1964 in San Juan, Puerto Rico. He received a BS from New York University. His work has been exhibited widely in New York and the surrounding area.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ivan Vera first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2001. They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, ephemera, correspondence, and CVs. These materials are dated 2001-2009.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jorge Veras was born in 1967 in Nyack, New York. He was raised in New York and the Dominican Republic. He received a BFA from Cooper Union. He has taught art and photography at elementary and high school levels. In addition to photography he has experience with video and television. His art has been exhibited in New York and Canada and has been published widely.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Jorge Veras first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain photographs, image lists, ephemera, CVs, artist's biographies, artist's statements, correspondence, exhibition announcements, a calendar, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1988-2000.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Joseph Vincent was born in 1942 in DeQuincy, Louisiana. He received a bachelor's in architecture from Rice University. His artwork includes watercolor painting and photography.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Joseph Vincent first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2008. They contain a CD with images of art and accompanying image list. These materials are dated 2006-2008.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Bruce T. Volpone was born in 1961 in New York City. His work includes mixed media sculpture, illustration, and painting.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bruce T. Volpone first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2000. They contain a CD with images of art and accompanying documentation, publications, photographic prints of art, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1976-2001.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Alan Walker was born in 1951 in Georgia. He received a BA from University of Mississippi. He primarily worked with paper and illustration, creating paper dolls, as well as illustration. He was also a poet and playwright. He passed away in 1996.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Alan Walker were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998 by Ken Golden. They contain an artist's biography, press releases, original artworks, original paper dolls from the series "Paper Women of the world" (approx. 1000), and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1971-1998.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jerome Walker was born in 1958 in New York City andstudied medical illustration at Long Island University. He has taught art throughout the US. He taught himself origami, which is his primary form of art, along with making jewelry. His work has been featured in various publications.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Jerome Walker first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, correspondence, an exhibition announcement, press clippings, photographic prints of artwork, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1998-2006.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Reginald Walker was born in 1946 in Chicago, Illinois. He studied fine binding and book conservation at the Newberry Library in Chicago before coming to New York to work and apprentice at the New York Public Library and Center for Book Arts. He lived in the East Village and knew many other writers and artists, including Vince Aletti, Brice Marden, Peter Hujar, and Tim Ely. His work has been exhibited in New York and is held in the collection of the New York Public Library and the Ruth and Marvin Sackner Archive of Concrete and Visual Poetry, University of Iowa. He passed away in 1988.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Reginald Walker donated to the Visual AIDS archive contain interview transcripts conducted by Megan N. Liberty. These materials are dated 2023.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Nora Wallower was born in 1940 in Abington, Pennsylvania. She studied at the Philadelphia College of Art and the Pratt Graphic Center. She moved to New York and lived in the Lower East Side but continued to paint rural landscapes and natural settings. Her work has been exhibited in New York and Pennsylvania. She passed away in 2008.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Nora Wallower first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain CVs, artist's statements, an exhibition announcement, correspondence, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1997-2005.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Francis Wasswa was born in 1948 in Masaka, Uganda. He studied art and works primarily in fiber arts, specifically with batik. His work has been exhibited in the US and Uganda.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Francis Wasswa first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2000. They contain calendar submission materials, artist's statements, and photographs of artwork. These materials are dated 2000.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jack Waters was born in 1954 in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. He received a BFA from Juilliard. He is a visual artist, filmmaker, writer, choreographer, performer, and media artist. He and his partner, Peter Cramer, are collaborators and have worked together on numerous artistic and community projects. Waters has exhibited internationally and his work is held in a number of permanent collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Jack Waters first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2010. They contain a CD with images of art, exhibition announcements, press clippings, CVs, press releases, photographs of artwork, exhibition materials, and publications. These materials are dated 2001-2016.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Patrick Webb was born in 1955 in New York City. He received a BFA from Maryland Institute College of Art and an MFA from Yale University. His artwork includes illustration and painting. Since 1990 he has represented his experiences using a clown character called Punchinello. His work has been exhibited internationally and is held in both public and private collections in the US and Europe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Patrick Webb first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1999. They contain exhibition materials, exhibition announcements, press clippings, publications, correspondence, image lists, images of artwork, exhibition catalogs, ephemera, CVs, an artist's statement, CDs with images of art, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1985-2020.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Kevin Wesley was born in 1960 in Los Angeles. He received a BFA from the University of New Mexico and an MFA from the University of Hawai'i, both in theatre. His work includes painting, collage, and illustration and has been exhibited in New Mexico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Kevin Wesley first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2004. They contain an artist's statement and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 2004.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Lonnie Robert Westeen was born in 1976 in Wakefield, Michigan and was raised in Wisconsin. He began making art at a young age and explored various mediums. He works in painting and mixed media, and as a performer and playwright.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lonnie Robert Westeen first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2011. They contain a CD with images of art and image list. These materials are dated 2009-2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Frederick Weston was born in 1946 in Memphis, Tennessee. He moved to New York in the early 1970s and studied menswear design and marketing at the Fashion Institute of Technology. He worked primarily in collage and photography, using photocopiers to create zines and party invitations. He exhibited widely in New York. He passed away in 2020.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Frederick Weston first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1997. They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, exhibition materials, artwork, correspondence, CVs, artist's biographies, press releases, press clippings, CDs with images of art, photographic prints of art, loan agreements, publications, and periodicals, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image lists. These materials are dated 1977-2023.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Kurt Weston was born in 1957 in Chicago, Illinois. He received a BS from Northern Illinois University and a BA from Columbia College. He worked as fashion photographer in the 1980s and 90s, before focusing on photographic art as a passion. His work has been exhibited nationally and internationally, as well as published widely. After losing his vision to CMV Retinitis, his focus shifted to artistic and experimental photography.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Kurt Weston first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2003. They contain exhibition announcements, ephemera, Postcards from the Edge submission materials, CDs with images of art with image list, grant application materials, artist's biographies, artist's statements, correspondence, CVs, press clippings, publications, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 2000-2010.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jessica Lynn Whitbread was born in 1980. She received a master's degree in Building Communities to Ignite Social Change from York University in Toronto, Ontario. She works in the realm of social practice and community art, often merging art and activism to engage a diversity of audiences in critical dialogue. She is very active in women's AIDS organizations and community work.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Jessica Lynn Whitbread donated to the Visual AIDS archive contain periodicals and ephemera. These materials are dated 2015.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: David Williams was born in 1955 in Antigonish, Nova Scotia. He studied at the Novia Scotia College of Art and Design, Cape Cod School of Art, and the School of the Museum of Fine Arts in Boston. A lifelong artist, he paints in impressionist and realist styles. His work has been exhibited in Florida and Massachusetts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: David Williams first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2002. They contain an artist's biography, an artist's statement, and correspondence. These materials are dated 2002.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Remerro "Trotsky" Williams was born in 1953 in Washington, DC. His father and grandfather were both painters, inspiring a love of art from a young age. He studied at the School of Visual Arts in New York and at Hoch Schuler der Kunste in West Berlin. He spent time in New York, Berlin, Paris, and London. His paintings have been shown in the US and internationally and are held in various private collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Remerro "Trotsky" Williams first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1999. They contain correspondence, press clippings, photocopies of artworks, photographs, an artist's biography, a CV, Postcards from the Edge submission materials and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1986-2018.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Albert Winn was born in 1947 in Chester, Pennsylvania. He studied housing and urban studies, urban planning, and art throughout his education, receiving a BS, an MA, and an MFA. His autobiographical photography work addresses Judaism, gender, and sexuality in the context of illness and memory. It has been exhibited in New York, California, Massachusetts, and internationally. He passed away in 2014.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Albert Winn first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain CVs, artist's biographies, ephemera, project proposals, exhibition text, artist's statements, correspondence, essays, publications, photographic prints of art, periodicals, and CDs with images of art, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1989-2010.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Bruce Witsiepe was born in 1951. He studied art at the Louisville School of Art and Cooper Union. His work includes sculpture, mixed media work, and performance. He exhibited primarily in New York and his work is held in collections internationally. He passed away in 1995.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Bruce Witsiepe were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 2000 by Tony Pinotti. They contain photographic prints of art, correspondence, a CV, collection of poetry, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1992-2000.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: David Wojnarowicz was born in 1954 in Red Bank, New Jersey. He dropped out of high school and hitchhiked across the US before settling in the East Village in 1978. He was a painter, photographer, writer, filmmaker, performance artist, and activist. He was prominent in the New York City art world in the 1980s and was very active politically after his AIDS diagnosis in the late 80s. He participated in public debates about medical research and funding, morality and censorship in the arts, and the legal rights of artists. He is the author of five books, and has artwork in numerous private and public collections, including MoMA and the Whitney. He passed away in 1992.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to David Wojnarowicz were first donated to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998 by Thomas Rauffenbert. They contain exhibition announcements, publications, exhibition programs, CVs, press releases, press clippings, exhibition catalogs, periodicals, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1983-2018.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Steven Wolf was born in 1948 in Johnstown, Pennsylvania. He received an MA in sculpture and an MFA in painting from West Virginia University. He works in painting and illustration, and has exhibited in Virginia, North Carolina, and New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Steven Wolf first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2002. They contain exhibition announcements, artwork on postcards, correspondence, CVs, artist's statements, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1999-2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Martin Wong was born in 1946 in Portland, Oregon. He was a painter whose meticulous visionary realism is among the lasting legacies of New York's East Village art scene of the 1980s and a precursor of the identity-driven work of the 90s. He was passionate about painting, calligraphy, antiques, and graffiti. His collection of over 300 works on graffiti was donated to the Museum of the City of New York. His work was exhibited widely in New York and across the US. He passed away in 1999.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Martin Wong first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain exhibition catalogs, CVs, press clippings, exhibition announcements, exhibition programs, handwritten pieces, correspondence, ephemera, memorial materials, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1982-2016.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Darrell Wood was born in 1956 in Greenville, Mississippi. He was classically trained as a ballet dancer and published poetry from the age of 17. He has worked as a graphic designer and web designer. He works primarily in painting and has exhibited in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Darrell Wood first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2002. They contain an artist's biography and grant submission materials. These materials are dated 2002.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: William M. Wood III was born in 1972 in Reading, Pennsylvania. He received a BA in psychology from the University of Texas. He studied ceramics, drawing, photography, and painting at schools and workshops around the country. His work has been exhibited in North and South Carolina. He passed away in 2016.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: William M Wood first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2009. They contain a CD with images of art and a CV. These materials are dated 2009.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Peter Wyman was born in 1958 in Providence, Rhode Island. He received a BA from Duke University and studied painting, printmaking, glassblowing, and calligraphy from various other institutions. His work includes painting, prints, and collage. It has been exhibited in widely in Florida and along the east coast.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Peter Wyman first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2005. They contain Postcards from the Edge submission materials, correspondence, copies of artwork, CDs with images of artwork with accompanying image list, CVs, press clippings, and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 1996-2011.

did.unittitle: Rev. Yolanda aka Roger Anthony Mapes (b. 1960)

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Rev. Yolanda (Roger Anthony Mapes) was born in 1960 in Muscle Shoals, Alabama. She is an accomplished, award-winning singer/songwriter, performance artist, visual artist, and interfaith minister. She was inducted into the GLBT Hall of Fame for Activism, Art, Excellence, and Community Awareness in 2005. A feature film about her life was released in June 2015.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rev Yolanda (Roger Anthony Mapes) first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1998. They contain a CV, an artist's statement, press clippings, exhibition announcements, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1998-2003.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Laurence Young was born in 1952 in Boston, Massachusetts. He received a BA in Art Education from Hartford Art School and an MFA in Printmaking from Rhode Island School of Design. His work is primarily in painting and has been exhibited widely along the east coast. He lives and works in Provincetown, Massachusetts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Laurence Young first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2001. They contain photographic prints, ephemera, CDs with images of art with accompanying image lists, exhibition announcements, correspondence, press clippings, CVs, artist's statements, image lists, calendar submission materials, an artist's biography, publications, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 1992-2012.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Kurt Zager (Schwerdtfeger) was born in 1965 in Margaretville, New York. As an adult, he studied at the New York Academy of Art. His paintings are primarily of nature and have been exhibited in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Kurt Zager (Schwerdtfeger) first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 1999. They contain an artist's biography. These materials are dated 1999.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Tal Zargarhof was born in 1961 in Israel. He was privately tutored for 10 years in pop art by artist Rom Gotfried. He moved to the US in 1984 and had six successful shows in New York. His artwork includes acrylic paintings, illustration, photography, and fabric design. He passed away in 2015.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tal Zargarhof first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2003. They contain correspondence, artist's biographies, images of artwork, and 35mm slide documentation of art. These materials are dated 2002-2015.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Andrew Zealley was born in 1956. He received an MFA from Ontario College of Art and Design University and a PhD through the Faculty of Environment and Urban Change (EUC) at York University in Toronto, Ontario. His artwork is organized around sound and listening practices and media including music, video, photography, bookmaking, pedagogy, and activism. He is based in Toronto, Canada.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials pertaining to Andrew Zealley include an event program. This material is dated 2013.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jeff Zimmer was born in 1970 in Minot, North Dakota. He was trained in theatre in Washington, DC before moving to Edinburgh, Scotland to obtain his masters in glass painting. His work is in the permanent collection of various museums in the UK and Europe. He teaches and works in Edinburgh.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Jeff Zimmer first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2004. They contain a CV and 35mm slide documentation of art with accompanying image list. These materials are dated 2002-2004.

did.unittitle: Zion Kyakulaga and Grace Talitwala Collective (b. 1972)

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Zion Kyakulaga and Grace Talitwala are artists who formed an art collective from Uganda. Working with natural materials, such as banana fiber and tree bark, they create works that reflect their experience with HIV/AIDS. They mentor young artists in Uganda.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Zion Kyakulaga and Grace Talitwala first donated materials to the Visual AIDS archive in 2000 as a collective. They contain an exhibit catalog, correspondence, calendar submission materials, a biography, and photographic prints. These materials are dated 1999-2001.
